Good beer and decent staff. Our waitress was friendly and pretty knowledgeable about the beer selection and recommendations based on our tastes. It's a nice after work spot or maybe a good 'in-and-out quick bite and a beer' before a show.

Went there on a Friday afternoon. Plenty of available seating and the hostess provided excellent service. Their burgers are always great. This time I tried 1/2 Havarti and Turkey Sandwich and 1/2 Ancho Chicken Salad with a side of Chipotle Coleslaw. The sandwich was pretty average, while the salad and coleslaw were fresh and flavorful. Overall, the service was really good for the price of food
Awesome. Food was delish; decor was very fresh and service was excellent. I'll definitely go back if I'm ever in Champaign again.

Miley family loves it. I've been several times and the Pot Pie was good. Service is always very friendly. Local craft beers are featured but none of the ones I tried rang my bell.
Oh, the pretzel appetizer is really good.

This restaurant has become a favorite. No matter what you eat, you can be assured it will be good. The Cuban sandwich has become one of my favorite sandwiches, the salad with goat cheese and fruit is good; the nachos are tasty, and the deserts are huge and out of this world. The sangria is a very tasty drink.

Restaurant is very cute, located in downtown Champaign with seating outside. Our server was Ariel (who was wonderful) and we were celebrating my daughter's bday who is a student at U of I.  We had the cheese curds which are awesome and really crispy and warm and yummy. We had those with the champaign blanc beer (yum) and for dinner we had the chicken pizza, bison burgers and the egg burger - everything was really delicious. Cooked to your liking.  For dessert we had the cherry bread pudding which was amazing, never had that before and the strawberry/mascarpone crapes (those were just OK).  They weren't warm as you expect crepes to be and the crape itself was almost too hard and crispy rather than soft and warm so next time I will skip those and go straight for the cherry pudding.  Overall, I have never really found a place that I would go to again while vising U of I but I would definately return to Destihl especially for the cheese curds and beer, which if you are a beer lover they have a very nice selection.  Thanks again Ariel for your excellent customer service and for being so attentive to our table!!
One of my favorite places in C-U . The strawberry goat cheese salad is my favorite and don't forget the strawberry pale ale.

This is a fun place with a trendy atmosphere. It's one of the few places in town that allow you to mix and match beer flights at a fair price. The food is fun and tasty. I recommend the mussels, pizzas, and wings.

I was recently invited to Champaign for a grad-school interview, and went out to dinner at Destihl on one of the nights I spent in town. I have to say that I found it very amusing that the priciest restaurant I went to on this trip was also the worst meal of the trip by far.

I ordered the goat-cheese pesto pizza, shared the battered asparagus appetizer, and had pint of the brown ale. The battered asparagus was alright but EXTREMELY greasy, the pizza was soggy and surprisingly didn't really taste like basil or goat cheese, and the brown ale was flat out bad (trust me, I drink a lot of microbrew beer, I know what good beer tastes like). Plus, most other people at my table agreed that their food and drinks were also mediocre. 

Needless to say, since this is an pricier restaurant, I doubt I'd be willing to give Destihl another shot.
Not worth the high cost.  Go across the street for a bit better grub if you want to spend the money.

Worst service in Champaign. We spent three hours for dinner: late reservation, drinks took nearly an hour, food took an hour, and it took them half an hour to process our checks. It was a comedy of errors. Food was average at best.

Great atmosphere, and the service was amazing. We had a huge group, and the waitress made sure that everyone was attended to and satisfied with their meals. She made a couple rounds with us to make sure we all had enough water as well. 

I had the braised pot roast, and I am so glad I picked it! I was scrolling through Yelp reviews myself when I was here, deciding what dish to choose. I was surprised to find that /no one/ commented on this dish, so I decided to give it a try. 

Braised pot roast [$13.95]: The braised beef was so incredibly soft and tender - I don't think I've ever had beef this tender before. It melts into your mouth so easily and tastes oh-so-good. It was a pretty generous helping of the braised beef as well. I thought it paired beautifully with the saut√©ed vegetables and mashed potatoes with gravy. The mashed potatoes were fluffy and airy, definitely made in house. Everything was like a wonderful melody playing in my head... couldn't stop eating it until I finished the entire plate! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this plate; DO give it a try!
I think their cedar plank salmon is off the hook good. The service is usually in point and I've never waited very long for a table. Great place.

Love love love this place! The date wrapped bacon a must try! Their blonde ale nice and light. David had the Asian paste. It was okay and spicy. Joyce had the hamburger with bacon and hand cut crispy fries.... The atmosphere was nice (elegant for a brewery) and clean and they have patio sitting, dogs allowed outdoors that is. Overall will return!
Very unique place to eat in Champaign.  My ceder plank salmon was excellent. I'm not much of a beer drinker but the 4oz pick your own flights are fun to try.

My wife, son, and I ate at Destihl a few days ago and had a fantastic experience there! This is a fairly new restaurant in downtown Champaign, and it's a place not to miss. Their menu is innovative, wide-ranging, and worthy of repeated visits. 

Dana, our server, was just superb! She responded to all our questions with a special attentiveness, and offered great advice on unusual food choices and palate-pleasing brews. She followed up often to make sure everything was just right throughout the meal. They should clone her! 

My wife had their charred broccolini and feta salad with other fantastic ingredients that she loved. My son had the havarti and hickory-smoked turkey sandwich on ciabatta that made him moan with delight. Having messed up my appetite earlier in the day on snacks, I ordered the corn and chicken chowder that turned out to be one of the best soups in recent memory, and a perfect choice for a light meal. 

Destihl Restaurant & Brew Works is a gem in the Champaign-Urbana area. Go try it out and you'll see what I mean!

Always content at Destihl. It's a nice safe choice. 

Appetizers: 
-bavarian pretzel: I love their pretzels here. It's so fluffy 
-chorizo stuffed dates: My favorite dish I had that day. Everything about it meshed together so well. Sweetness from the date, a little salty from the bacon that's wrapped around the dates. Great texture because of the crispyness from the bacon and softness from the dates. Loved it!

Meal: 
I got the Beer battered bacon and egg burger. I really liked it! The beer battered bacon was delicious. Egg was nice touch, but could have done without it. 

My cousin got the Carolina BBQ? (forgot what it was called) They were decent, but if you're looking for a good meat dish, I would go elsewhere. 

Pizza is quite mediocre. Sorry :( My excuse is that I live near Chicago. 

Overall, their menu is about 3 pages with all sorts of dishes. I think it's a little too ambitious, resulting in nothing that special about their restaurant (except for their beer! good beer) which is why I think that it's a nice, safe choice because you never leave disappointed. But, it won't be something like, "THIS IS THE BEST THING I'VE EVER HAD." (Probably some place I would go twice a year?)

I think this place is a little bit over-hyped. The burgers are pretty fantastic and quite juicy, but the food takes quite a bit of time to prepare. Not in the this-is-gonna-be-awesome type of preparation, but more of the my-food-is-lukewarm preparation. Given the amount of time you have to put into reservations and fighting the crowds, I say there are better bets elsewhere. However, definitely still worth a taste if you're into fancy interiors and great service.

Well, I searched the website to see where I wanted to have my birthday dinner with my coworkers.  I was seeking out a restaurant that had a little bit of this and a little bit of that so that everyone can find something that they would enjoy eating.  Everyone enjoyed their dishes and we kept on watching the staff bring out different dishes as we would comment how yummy it looks.

I was torn between two dishes and I asked the staff their recommendation.  She did not steer me wrong.  It was so tasty that I wanted to eat another entree of it.  Every dish they brought to the table look so tempting.  Definitely a wide variety and everyone enjoyed a nice beer and atmosphere.  

Glad we made reservations because the place filled up quick for a Friday night.  Service was awesome and I am already missing it.  I will definitely be back before I leave town.

Tried this place around 5:30 on a weeknight and it was not at all busy. It did start getting busier towards the end of the meal, but our service was good. Luckily for me I had not been highly anticipating the opening of Destihl. The beers were good enough. There were about a dozen to choose from so if you drink beer at all, you should be able to find one you like. The night we went in we were given free 2oz samples of as many of the beers  as we wanted to try. I tried the Belgian, Strawberry Blonde and Raspberry Wheat, Champaign Blond and Frankengluten - good flavors, but none will be appearing on my all-time favorites list. The Frankengluten was interesting and worth a try if you are adventurous. Our waiter was nice and attentive enough but could not properly give drink recommendations since he was not old enough to drink. I thought this strange since, clearly, patrons are going to want to know about the beer. The food... I had the brie and portabello sandwich with chips. The chips were average and the sandwich was bland. That's honestly about the best I can say. My dinner partner said his steak salad was excellent and it looked fresh and crisp, but I can't vouch for the taste. We split the beer battered asparagus and that was by far my favorite item. I will probably go back at some point for another try. The pizza and a desserts sounded like they may have potential.

Second visit 8/27/11: Finally tried the pizza (pesto and goat cheese) and still really no change in my review. Nice wait staff but the food does not overly impress. You do receive a large quantity of food for the price. Although, for me, quantity does not trump quality.

I really enjoyed this place.  We had a large group of people celebrating my grandma's birthday.  There was about 15 of us so we had our own separate room.  The service was really great! I wish I knew the waiters name because he went above and beyond to make sure we all had what we need.  It was fairly fast service as well for being as many of us as there were.  I liked the menu selection here to.  Lots of gourmet and different food items to choose from, not the same old stuff you see at most restaurants.  They have a unique twist to your average or popular dishes.  Pretty cool.

Now on to the food.... They had me at beer battered jalape√±o bacon! Omg it was delicious! We also tried the beer battered asparagus which was equally as good.  For my meal I got the green chile mac and cheese with pork.  It was good, I wish I would've ordered something with a bit more substance (not much meat in it) but I guess that was my own fault! The flavor of what I had was great though.  I also tried my moms stuffed pablano pepper which was great! I wish I would've gotten that.  Everyone seemed to love their food here.  

Oh, and the carrot cake is TO DIE FOR! I highly recommend it, the pieces are as big, if not bigger, than my head! 

The prices were also fair.  I really enjoyed this place! Wish there was more places like this (for this same price range) around Schaumburg.

The wait staff have been among the friendliest I have encountered in town. Last night I had a good mojito. For food, it is sometimes hit and miss. I love the salmon salad. The goat cheese and spinach salad was a little skimpy and I didn't recognize the two little dollops of goat cheese on the salad. The tortilla soup was also nothing to write home about. It is the only place in town with cheese curds!  I absolutely love the baked apple dessert! In the evenings, the sun is in just the right place to give a nice shade for the outdoor seating. All in all, I have always enjoyed my visits to Destihl.

The menu has a good variety of options, which is nice.  I have had the bison burger twice, but they seem to always cook it a little too much. I tried it medium once and medium rare another time, and both times they cooked it longer than they should of.  But it still tasted good.  

Service at the bar was very good.

We are staying in Champaign on our way back to the East coast. We looked at Yelp and as soon as I saw Destihl's menu I knew this was the place. It was terrific! Our server, Alex, was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The menu was everything I'd hoped for and tasted as good as it sounded in print. I had the Minted Man cocktail. Refreshing and delicious! The sandwiches were huge and delicious. I wish we'd split a sandwich and saved room for dessert. We are already looking for reasons to come back to Champaign so we can eat here again!

The menu has changed considerably from a couple years ago. The Food is adequate but not great for the price like it used to be. The Hamburgers are OK, but not really worth $15. I assume the $35 steak is an attempt at humor.

They have good food options. They could work more on the vegetarian options. Nice beer. Some people may like this, but I personally don't like waiters coming back every 10-15 mins asking how the food is and if everything is okay. But I understand that they are trained to do the same.

I really was not expecting to give a brewpub 5 stars...but here goes...
We went on a Monday night, and the restaurant was FULL which was A) good to see for a new business and B) surprising! The decor is surprisingly upscale - really cool use of natural stone and wood. HUGE shame they didn't open with their patio ready to go, but when I inquired they said it was in the plans to open the patio soon.
The beers (I tried 5, yup 5) were decent - not world-class, but decent. My favorite purely for summer drinkability was the Champaign Blonde, but I am admittedly not into dark beers at all, and there are PLENTY of dark ones and heavier Begian-style ales which I didn't try.
The menu looked surprisingly interesting, (I was expecting burgers and pretzels), and between us we tried the pickled cucumber salad, the tuna carpaccio, the strawberry salad and the warm salmon and potato salad. All four dishes were winners, although the small plates ARE really small (which is exactly what we wanted). The entrees are MASSIVE for the price, and look like they are high quality meals, but I'm glad we saw how big they were before we ordered one!
Service was excellent from beginning to end.
The desserts also looks amazing, but I was too full to try. As a gay couple it was nice to feel comfortable and that there was a real mix of clientele - I was scared it was going to be exclusively Olive Garden-goers, but there were some hipsters, some queens, and some students as well as your typical 'casual-dining' crowd.
Can't wait for the patio to open, but believe me, there will be a serious wait time on those tables - be prepared!

DESTIHL is one of my go-to's when bringing friends and family from out of town out to dinner- not only does it have an extensive menu that will cater to even the pickiest of guests, their service is excellent and we always leave there full and happy! 

For apps: The Bavarian style pretzels are soft and fluffy, and the IPA mustard sauce is a nice treat. We have also enjoyed the skillet nachos, and the cheese curds; however, we usually go for a dessert instead of an app.

Entrees:I try to get something new each time I go, and some of my favorites include the dijon chicken, the coulotte steak, the vegan squash and cashew cream "pasta", the gaucho skirt steak, and the brewmaster's pizza.

Like I said, don't skip on the dessert; I get the chocolate peanut butter mousse cake every single time (though you'll want to share it if you want to be able to walk out of the restaurant on your own!), and the toffee date doughnuts are a surprising treat. My fiance adores their giant carrot cake and sour cherry bread pudding if you're not a chocolate lover like me.

I do recommend making a reservation as it can get quite busy, and though I haven't been yet I have heard fabulous things about their weekend brunch so give that a shot if you have a chance!

Terrific menu and service. My daughter and I had the Bavarian pretzels as appetizer (warning two gigantic pretzels!)--they were fresh and deliciously soft and warm--but very filling. My daughter had the bacon cheeseburger and I had the brewmaster pizza. Both were good enough to warrant repeat visits. We ordered the carrot cake to go--it's gigantic and exceptional--the size of a serving platter. We blissfully worked on it for two days.

We always give this place a try every couple of years, just because it's one of the nicer places to eat around downtown and some people love it, but everytime I have went it has been awful. I always say no pickles (or sauce based on pickles) and they always put it on. And everytime we say something we are given a rude stare by the server and an attitude about it. After bringing out a "new dish" it's obvious it's the same one and they just took it off. Pickles have strong flavor, you can't hide it. And sometimes you can see that the sauce had been scraped. Overall, very negative experience and too many things with pickles.

My kid begged me to give Desthil another chance so I obliged. This time the service didn't disappoint. We had the same waitress as before which made it a tad awkward since our past experience was very blah. After eating, one of the managers or perhaps an asst. manager came by. She indicated that our waitress had revealed our past unhappy experience and wanted to make sure we were ok and appreciated that we had come back. Needles to say I was very surprised. Props to the waitress for not only remembering but acknowledging our prior discontent. We were given a comp card and apologized for the past fumble. I appreciated it. I guess any establishment can have a bad night. The food was on point.

The food was okay, but the beer was flat, the service was poor, and the atmosphere was rushed and unattractive.  How can a brewery serve flat beer and keep it's doors open?  Hopefully, it was a bad night
It is a place with excellent service and excellent food. The quality of the food is better than the price and the place has a classy atmosphere without the pompous attitude.

Last time I went to i tried two of the appetizers, the ceviche and the cured salmon, and I can say it is the best thing I've tried there so far! The staff was absolutely amazing. 
Howver, although the dijon chicken saucewas great, the chicken itself was a bit dry and the sitting and food wait time was ridiculously long!!!

Destihl is one of my favorite restaurants in champaign! I travel for work, and this is definitely a great place to eat/ drink alone or with a group. If eating at the bar, the servers are very attentive. If eating at a table, it's the same as well. If you can eat on the patio, do it. 

The menu is extensive and has a great variety-- whether you're looking for sandwich/burger or a full entree. Everything I've tried so far has been great. They also have awesome beers. They brew sour beers, which I had never tried until I came here. 

Overall, great place to go no matter what you're looking for! Try the salmon and the cheese curds!

We were sat in one of the bar high tops for an 830 Saturday night dinner. Service was prompt and casual. I had a martini but would probably stick to beer in the future. Different beer portions allow for different tastings. The dessert list looked interesting but we were too full to try anything. 

CHORIZO STUFFED DATES ($5.95 for 3 small dates) - The dates had a nice smokiness flavor to them and did not need the sauce which over powered the dish. 

DUCK CONFIT POT PIE ($15.95) - At first I thought it looked soupy but once I started eating it realized the vegetable to sauce ratio was well balanced. The crust is non traditional as a pillow of herb puff pastry sitting on top of the vegetables (duck confit, roasted golden beets, brussels sprouts, pearl onions, sweet potatoes, green beans, fingerling potatoes, and swiss chard). A tad too salty but otherwise a playful, hearty dish.

CUBAN-STYLE PORK ($9.95) - A good portion with juicy ham and all the fixings. 

Come in for some local beer and casual bites.

This place has it together! We came here after waiting 25 minutes at a nearby restaurant with no service. DESTIHL was very busy, which is always a good sign. After a brief wait, we were seated and acknowledged immediately by our server. Not only were the beers top notch, but the food and service was as well! We had water refills and empty plates cleared by other servers who happened to be walking by. We couldn't have asked for a better experience!

I had a really good Thai pork pizza here. Waiter was very personable. We were able to get in with a party of 4 on the Friday night of graduation weekend without a reservation around 5pm- didn't think it was possible given how popular this place is.  My family had been there before and said the beer battered bacon appetizer was amazing, so we ordered it and it didn't quite live up to the memories of it.  Lots of beers and wines, but appeared to not have ciders.

My sons favorite restaurant in Champaign-Urbana!  I would call it eclectic bar food. Excellent appetizers - especially the beer battered bacon and the fried green tomatoes.  This was our fourth time eating there and we have never been disappointed.

I've only eaten here a couple times. The food is good and they have some interesting specialty beers on occasion. I don't really go here to eat, even though the food is good and nothing's wrong with it. It's just not my go to place when my friends and I want to go out somewhere. 

Perhaps I will update my review the next time I eat there. For now, this is all I've got.

3/15/2015 update: I came here for Sunday brunch with a large group of friends. I had half a Cuban sandwich and the strawberry goat cheese salad. Both very delicious. Although, I think I'll order the French toast next time, it looked so good! :) Brunch is a big thumbs up.

I love Destihl! We have come here many times and always bring our out of town friends here.  It's always busy, and with good reason. The atmosphere is casual, and the food is great and decent quality. Our friends love the samples of their micro-brews. From "Smile Politely," (Champaign-Urbana's online magazine) "DESTIHL Restaurant & Brew Works of Champaign, Illinois, won a bronze medal at the 2012 Great American Beer Festival in Denver, Colorado for its Strawberry Blonde Ale in the 'Fruit Beer' category."

The menu has many options ranging from salads to burgers to pizza.
 I personally love the beer-battered asparagus and beer-battered fish and chips. 
My husband has ordered the fish tacos on one occasion and pizza on another. The fish tacos were okay. The pizza is good. They also have a gluten-free menu and a kids' menu. Even though we have never taken our 2.5 year old to a kids' restaurant, and she is used to dining with grown-ups in grown-up restaurants, it's nice that they accommodate young diners with crayons to color on the kids' menu. Even the most patient young foodie could use a quiet distraction while they wait. 

Glad we have this restaurant in the C-U. I highly recommend it.

I tried out Destihl this past weekend and it was definitely one of the best meals I've had since moving to Illinois.

For our appetizer, we had the warm pretzels.  I'm a big fan of the cheese sauce they come with and they were gone pretty quickly.  I also sampled the fried cheese curds and they were tasty as well.  For my meal, I had the fried egg BLT.  You really can't go wrong with bacon, a fried egg and avocado on a sandwich.  The garlic dressing on  the sandwich was great too.  I was really pleased.

I ordered an iced tea and I think it's my own fault for not looking at it on the menu, but I expected a regular iced tea.  Their iced tea is an orange tea that has a pretty strong orange flavor.  I wasn't a fan.  Our server exchanged it for a soda and I wasn't charged for it.

Definitely give it a try if you're in the area.

Every time I go to Destihl, I just find myself truly enjoying every dish. There are always some really interesting flavors going on and Destihl really does distinguish itself above its competitors, the other sort of new american or gastropub restaurants.

Destihl does brew its own beer and it's generally pretty good, always a very reasonable price. You can also get growlers for like $20. Great deal. They generally have one of each type of brew and they're generally pretty solid brews. I got the Bela - Imperial Pilsner - which was great. Good, strong beer but very drinkable.

This time I started with the Corn & Chicken chowder which has a bit of chipotle espresso BBQ sauce on top. Wonderful flavors, really was. Very delicate corn flavor mixed with the hint of bbq and given some weight from the just marginally creamy chowder. The soup was nothing short of phenomenal. 
Must Have.

I then had the Farm & Field burger. Really interesting combination of flavors between the lamb and the bison within the patty and then it's topped with just a wonderful combination of delicious ingredients. Who would've thought that combining pesto, sun dried tomato aioli, havarti cheese, soy onions, etc on a burger would produce such an intriguing concoction of flavors!! My bun did come out quite burnt, but the rest of the burger made up for it.
I'd get it again in a heartbeat.

Only downside, no room for dessert.
Can't wait to go back.
Wonderful service,  great food. Our waitress was attentive and accommodating, they had homemade beer battered bacon, which was unbelievable

My first and hopefully last visit to Destihl was a faculty dinner (Destihl is apparently one of the few places in town large enough to accommodate simultaneous departmental functions, as there were multiple university-based parties that night). But this convenience is off-set by the depressingly overblown chain aesthetic, here manifesting as a too-self-conscious effort to seem "on trend" with both gastro pubs and microbreweries (witness, for instance, the giant prop barrels by the front door) while failing to capture the particular qualities of either. 

The "artisan food" was as mediocre as expected from this self-described "gastrobrewpub TM." We ordered pizzas as appetizers for the table; "stone oven" seems to be a euphemism for "toaster oven." The crusts were uniformly thin, but creepily so, without bubbling or crispness; the undersides were barely cooked. I suspect pre-formed frozen dough, by the taste and all-too-regular texture. The generous toppings were not supported by the crust, making each slice limp and increasingly wet. We also ordered the deep-fried asparagus, but I refrained -- the asparagus looked both too thick (these stalks were almost hot-dog-sized in circumference!) and too greasy.

One of our dinner companions warned us against ordering burgers; on her last visit, her medium rare burger was burned black on one side (and was not at all medium rare). She guessed that the cooks went outside for a smoke and forgot to flip the burgers, but generously wondered if it had just been a long night for them in the kitchen. In an attempt to heed her advice, I tried to order the grilled and stuffed pasta without olives, but the waiter told me that the olives "are already mixed in." I took that to mean that the pasta is made in a giant vat ahead of time (here I imagined a big plastic tub covered in Saran wrap in a walk-in freezer), and grilled to order, which didn't sound all that appetizing. Instead, I ordered the veggie burger (black beans and rice), and my g.f. the Kobe burger, medium rare. Both arrived with one black, charred side; her burger was well-done, ruining the meat. (Why eat Kobe beef if it's just going to be burned to a crisp?) My veggie burger was unremarkable, and my pile of shoestring fries had been overcooked in the fryer, and served to me lukewarm to cold -- totally inedible. I nibbled on two and then had to stop. Cold grease, ugh.

I'd much rather order a burger and fries from Steak 'n' Shake, where you know what you're getting for the money. Overall, Destihl was a big "no way." I will strenuously avoid coming here again!
Every time I visit my daughter at University of Illinois, we come to Destihl. The food is fantastic and the service is great!

Try the soft pretzels with drinks or dinner and the stout ice cream and split their huge serving of chocolate cake for desert. 

The rest of the food is pretty tasty but less outstanding. One of the only microbrews in town, so props for that. Not unreasonable prices, but a little more than some nearby restaurants.

Service: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Drinks: 5/5
Atmosphere: 5/5

Service: Every waiter or waitress I've had at Destihl have been fantastic at their job and go above and beyond. They definitely deserve a 20%+ for their outstanding service. They treat everyone right no matter how you're dressed or who you are.

Food: I've never had a negative experience with their food. It's never over salted which unfortunately seems to be a problem with nearby restaurants and definitely never bland. Almost everything is seasoned to perfection and done right. Whoever their head chef is definitely deserves props.

Drinks: Destihl has their own brewery and their beers are definitely one of the high points of not just their restaurant but the town. Highly recommend the Destihl Hefeweizen, one of the best there is.

Atmosphere: It's definitely upscale, but not snobby, the best mix of comfort and friendliness you can find in a restaurant. Everyone is there to have a great time and not to impress.

Luckily, we went with family, so we got to eat off each other's plates! Everything was DELICIOUS! We started off with 4 appetizers. The deep fried bacon, fried green tomatoes, soft pretzels, and bacon wrapped dates. All were fabulous and recommended, but the fried green tomatoes were unbelievable! You really can't go wrong with this menu, and the wait staff is really knowledgeable. They helped guide those who were unsure to a good choice. The poblano peppers with chorizo was off the charts great and the Thai chicken wasn't too far behind. The fried bacon and egg burger was out of this world, but you better have a big appetite! One of the teenagers ordered fish and chips. They even elevated fish and chips! Even with all of this food, we ordered dessert! The sour cherry bread pudding and the banana cream pie were my favorites! The carrot cake was a close second! We had a great family dinner and EVERYONE loved what they got and went home happy! And with a family of 14, that almost never happens.

It was an alright meal with good things and just ok things.

The good: That cucumber/rose martini. Yes. Also, the fried green tomatoes appetizer with the crab/avocado salad on top. So delicious! Swordfish tacos were enjoyed.

The bad: the bacon wrapped dates. The bacon wasn't crispy so it was tough to chew. The sauce was so spicy we were practically crying. Salmon sandwich special was not as good as anticipated, and the bacon on the bacon cheeseburger was also not crispy. 

The service was so-so. While our waiter at the beginning was friendly, he repeatedly forgot things so we would spend time sitting there staring at our food because we didn't have plates or silverware. They also ran out of wine glasses so we were left sitting through our entrees without drinks that were ordered before entrees arrived, and he didn't tell us until we were finished eating.

Overall, it'd be worth a shot to visit again but if the 2nd experience was similar or worse, I wouldn't try a 3rd time.

Take a look at Destihl's menu and it looks likes an epicurean delight. Their menu is over 3 pages chock full of impressive ingredients, classic american fare as well as intriguing fusion items. The beer is delicious and brewed in house. So how could this local watering hole get two stars? By attempting to do everything, Destihl doesn't distinguish itself as doing anything particularly well.

I had the cuban style sandwich, which was not only pricey but also mediocre. I've eaten cubanos for years and theirs was merely average. I like a heaping of mustard and pickle to cut the richness of the ham and braised pork but theirs was entirely dry, lacking any kind of condiment to make the sandwich go down easier. Additionally, their side of cucumbers in a sambal and sesame oil sauce was way too spicy, without the usual east asian accompaniment of vinegar to smooth out the pure heat from the sambal. Vinegar and sesame oil is a very traditional way of dressing cucumbers in China so there is no excuse for missing out on that ingredient. 

What's more egregious was my dining companion's reuben sandwich, which completely lacked any kind of russian or thousand island dressing altogether. Although both rather goy individuals, we do appreciate that a reuben basically demands some kind of dressing like that. 

It could be that we picked some items on the menu that the kitchen considers afterthoughts but after a lackluster experience I will be way more guarded the next time I am here.

Came here once with a big group. Portions were huge and dessert was delicious (and pretty!). ...Then someone got food poisoning and had to sleep it off for the rest of the day. It was probably the beer, since the only person to get it was the only person to get sick and we shared everything else around the table. It was an experience but I'm not sure if I would come here again without some amount of peer pressure.

I'm a beer nerd, and I'm disappointed by this place so far. I plan to give it more chances, but I've tried the brown ale, Belgian single, a kolsch, and a pale ale, and have been relatively uninspired by nearly all of them.

The website lists some hoppier alternatives, but I haven't seen them actually on the menu.
????????????????????????????????One word for the ladies at the front: unprofessional.

I had 2 different beers; they were both pretty good. 

I ordered the mussels. Over half were not open. I sent them back. Second time about 5 were not open (not acceptable to me). The broth was good, however. 

I also had the pepperoni pizza. It was decent. My bf got the cod, it was very tasty. Next time, I will probably try an entree. 

It was very busy when we went, but we sat in the bar. Service was good.

I travel a ton for work and dine out more than I probably want to. I am typically pretty much numb to restaurant food but my meal tonight was absolutely fantastic. First of all the beer was really good, the service was fantastic and very friendly and my meal was  phenomenal. I had the house salad and the flat iron steak with blue cheese fingerling potatoes and saut√©ed asparagus. The chimichurri sauce on the side was literally the icing on the cake.

Went out with a couple of my friend's for one of their birthdays. It was our first time there and the food was so savory and the portion size was more than enough as well! We tried 8 of their 4oz beers and all of them tasting great. Our server Hannah was super helpful and very attentive. Overall, great food, great vibes, great drinks, great service.

What a great meal and fun time last night.
Server was Alex and he was outstanding!
started with a flight and a drink and the battered bacon, YUM
Hubby had the skirt steak I had the jambalaya
topped it off with dessert and we never do that, pastry with fresh fruit and lemon curd
We did not want to leave and can not wait to go back!

I went here with friends last week. I'll begin by saying that the food is a bit pricey for Champaign-Urbana, but you do get what you pay for. I had an amazing steak meal with an excellent entree, great microbrew beer and amazing desert. 

A lot of the dishes feature very interesting combinations of tastes and textures that add up to very delicious food. 

The decor is nice; lots of dark hardwood in a fairly unique interior. 

One word of advice: make a reservation if you're going during the evening. The place is very busy.

Once a year we go to Champaign and I always dread the restaurant choices.  We like this place!  Easy going vibe, spacious bar, everything squeaky clean, good beers to sample and the good variety menu that goes along well with everything.  
The sandwiches, soup and salads were excellent for lunch and there were plenty of people sampling the many items on the menu... which made it impossible for us to get a table the next night without waiting.  So next time when I go, I will make a reservation.

We had 12:30 lunch reservations.  Waited to be seated roughly 10 minutes. Sat unattended for 20 minutes.   At 1:00 we finally saw a server.  This was the first time someone had even acknowleged us.  we ordered beers and the waited another 20 minutes for the first round to arrive at our table.  50 minutes after walking in we finally had a drink!  At a bar no less! We were celebrating a birthday and would have ordered more rounds of drinks if we could have.  we saw the server 3-5 times total and only were able to order 2 beers.  My hamburger was raw and an individual kids pizza was terrible.  The topping just slid off of the crust.  Very sad we chose this option.

Normal, IL location.  Came for the beer and a snack on our way driving home to Madison WI from Memphis.  We had an hour to spend since we had a 10 -12 hr drive incl breaks.  Super upscale brewpub compared to what we're used to in WI (this was especially disliked by my beer connoisseur boyfriend).  Keep in mind we came on New Year's Eve at about 8:00 and the customers and hosts may have bee more dressy than usual (waitstaff in jeans, collared shirts).  The server greeted us promptly.  She was very nice and it's obvious she takes pride in doing a good job.  She took literally about 5 minutes to tell us in depth about the food specials, down to that they use butter not margarine, desert specials down to what pannacotta is and its texture ...uh yea, I know what pannacotta is..., where the beef comes from, how much the 32oz steak weighs with and without the bone..... We aren't big meat eaters and rarely eat beef.  Got the $12 ceviche appetizer, which was good.  The beer is EXCELLENT.  Hefeweizen, Sours, chocolate raspberry stout (prominent rasp/chocolate flavored but not sweet -like many fruit/chocolate beers- faintly tart from raspberries and nicely baking cocoa type bitter from the chocolate... Interesting to have bitter in beer not from hops) and couple others.
At the end, we mentioned to our server we came mainly for the beer and even if for food it would be good to find out if the customer is interested in the item before going in depth of detail.... Particularly before they have drinks or even water in front of them.... About 5 min after she took our drink order, she came back with water and we watched our drinks appear on the bar 5 min later and sit there another 5 while she was at another table (going in depth again?). She acknowledged she went deep in detail with the food but said they're supposed to.  I suggest they reconsider the approach with this.

Decent beers and bar. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff, a good default selection if you can't decide where to go in downtown CU. The food is the weak part of the place (usually under-seasoned and just bland in my opinion), with exception of some pizzas, and the desserts that are generally pretty good.

I've been to Destihl a handful of times, and I can honestly say that I've never been disappointed by anything I've ordered. That being said, I still find it hard to give it 5 stars. It's one of those places that although it's very good, it's not as great as expected.

The atmosphere is nice, and gives you a kind of upscale type of vibe. The beer is spot on every time we go. They brew their own beer and there's something available for everyone's taste. The menu is unique in that they offer a lot of dishes that you won't find somewhere else in CU, such as their swordfish tacos (which are amazing). Although the food is good, it's quite pricey. The beer is definitely the backbone of this place.

Overall, I would definitely recommend giving this place a try. If you love beer and quality food, it's definitely the place for you.

Been there two times. One time was way back with a group of friends on busy Saturday lunch. Had to wait for some time which wasn't a problem but once we got seated no one came to our table for almost thirty minutes. Finally, the server came and said since we carried some drinks with us while waiting for the table at the bar he thought we had ordered already and was taken care of. Then, I ordered Dijon chicken it wasn't that good either. Left half of it in the plate.

Today, it had been long since we hadn't gone to dine in  at this place so we went for the dinner. The service was fast and good. Our server had good knowledge of the food and beer collection they had. The beer was awesome. The food however, was just ok! We got bacon appetizer which was just ok, and the chicken pot pie and chicken risotto. The food was just on the ok side. Nothing to rave about. This place is good for some beers but food wise i really don't prefer to eat here.

Hmm.  The problem with Destihl is that it's either GOOD or it's BAD.  That's kind of why the review is an in-between.  

This place is off the charts when it comes to liquor.  Just don't buy booze here.  That's my honest feedback.  We had a party of 8, once, and only a few drinks were ordered (a couple waters, two ordered pop) and the bill was something astronomical (like $180!).  

The other thing about Destihl is that it's a microbrewery (and,-cough-, gastropub) that's trying to be a microbrewery and a -cough- gastropub, if you catch my drift?  If not, here's the thing-- it's pretentious as all get out.  And for who knows what reason, really.  It's kind of a dimly lit restaurant/bar that's just as non-descript as any other.  It tries too hard to be what it thinks it is, and doesn't try hard enough to be a good restaurant.

With that said, though, some of their food is just out-of-the-ballpark, OUT-OF-THIS-WORLD awesome.  All of their soups (3 cheese and ale, or the tomato basil).  The Havarti and Turkey is lovely, as is the Cuban style pork (tho, I did find a very unappetizing piece of fat in it the very last time I had it, so it kind of put me off it for a while).

You can't go wrong with a burger. =)  But, then again, it's a burger, they're not reinventing the airplane.

I say... if you want to spend a mint for the possibility of some good food, and then an outrageous bar tab, pick Destihl.  But if you're looking for beer and semi-comparable food, check out Hooters or Buffalo Wild Wings. The same in theory, just a different point-of-view.

Tasty food, solid drink selection, and great location in the heart of downtown Champaign. It's not on my "must-visit" list, but it's one of my regular options for lunch or night on the town. 

I'd recommend the beer battered bacon cheeseburger. It's delicious and beyond indulgent.

I'm not a fan of their house brews, though. It seems like, regardless of style, most of them taste too much alike. I'm just not a fan of the brewmaster's style.

I wanted to come back and let ya'll know that Destihl has recently become vegan-friendly!  The marinated cucumbers and beer-battered asparagus are both vegan as-is, and Destihl has added an 8 oz veggie burger to their menu that can be made vegan if the mayo's left off.  I believe there are a few other items that are vegan (the peanuts and the chips are, sans ranch dip), but I haven't confirmed them with the chef, so I'll leave you to figure that out on your own!

Hitting the big 5-0-0 with a great restaurant from my hometown!

-

The vitals:

Downtown microbrewery + restaurant with a slightly hip industrial vibe.  Great food, great beer.  Best part?  Small (4oz) tasting portions $1-2.  GREAT service.

-

Every time I visit my parents in good ol' Chambana they have a "new restaurant in town" that hubby and I MUST try.  Or five.  This time, Destihl was first on their list... and they are so crazy about it, they took us twice.  In ONE DAY.

First, for lunch.  No beer this visit (hence the second), just lunch.  I had the Portabella Sandwich with Shoestring Fries, and it was 100% delish.  Also on the table:

- Stuffed poblano pepper
- Cuban sandwich
- Salad with ahi tuna
- Clam chowder 

I heard nothing but raves from the group.

Late that evening we stopped in for post-dinner drinks "and maybe a little to munch on."  We got three appetizers for the table:

- Chorizo & Potato Flautas
- Marinated Cucumbers (there's some BITE to those suckers!)
- Brewmaster's Pizza (yuuuuuumm)

... and all got a few 4oz tasting pours.  The beer was fantastic, some of the best I've had.  Our waiters both times were friendly and went out of their way to make sure we had a good time.


One of my favorite things about this restaurant is the story my dad told (more than once) about his friend's first visit.  They were a big group, 12 I think, and stopping in before seeing a show in downtown.  They ordered food, drinks, then dessert.  There was a delay in the kitchen and they were kept waiting on their dessert for quite while... they were now running short on time, so one of the guys flagged down their waiter and told him, maybe a touch rudely, that they "needed either dessert or the check, because we gotta get out of here."  The manager came back a couple of minutes later, apologized profusely, and served their dessert.  Dessert or check, and Destihl chose dessert.  Their meal and drinks for 12 were on the house.

It's those kinds of stories that spread your business' name in the best possible way - you chose wisely, Destihl.  The guy's been sending over everyone he knows, always prompting with "you gotta hear how amazingly this restaurant treated me!"

Destihl is one of my favorite restaurants in Champaign-Urbana. My friends and I loved coming here. It caters to almost every taste. There are burgers, pasta, vegetarian dishes, pizza, sandwiches, and more. Also, the beer is soooo good!!!!! They make their own beer and they have a distillery inside the restaurant, which is really cool.. They offer 4oz drinks for less than $2, so you can try out multiple drinks if you can't decide what you want. 

The beer battered asparagus is a MUST try!!! The sweet but tangy Asian inspired sauce drizzled on top of the asparagus was so delicious. The size of the asparagus' was ginormous! 10/10 everyone should try these. Our server saw how much I liked the sauce and brought out a side of the sauce for me to dip my fries in haha. 

Also, the beer-battered bacon and egg burger is amazing!!! If you are a burger lover, you HAVE to try this burger. The beer-battered bacon was astonishing. It was crunchy, flavorful, and different. I loved it. It was messy because of the egg, but you know it's going to be good when it's messy.

Honestly, I'm a little surprised that Destihl's Yelp rating isn't higher. 

Two of my friends and I wandered in on a weekday night while looking for a place to eat at in downtown Champaign. The restaurant was relatively full for 7pm on Thursday, so I'd imagine there may be a wait on weekend nights. 

Beers = good. I think we tried 4? The strawberry blonde ale on tap was a clear favorite for us. Both their beer and dinner menus took awhile for us to look at. I was expecting traditional pub-style food, but their offerings far exceeded that.

We started off with the deviled egg appetizer and the beer battered bacon appetizer. Both were very good- the beer battered bacon is a MUST. Jalapeno bacon in a tempura-like beer batter coating topped with a drizzle of maple chipotle glaze?! Yes please! When it came to our table, we slowly stopped talking and watched our plate of bacon descend in front of us. Like it came down straight from heaven. We didn't even realize we stopped talking and didn't remember what we were talking about until the bacon was gone..

My friends got the jambalaya and the prosciutto-wrapped meatloaf. I really only tried part of the super tasty andouille sausage corn muffin that came with the jambalaya, as I was working on my full slab of beer-braised ribs (I gave one rib each to my friends to try though). They were perfect. Orders of magnitude better than Black Dog's ribs. I'm not sure whether or not that's a fair comparison since it's different cooking styles, but the texture of Destihl's ribs was absolutely perfect- tender, falling off the bone, but not annoyingly so.. The flavor was great also, as it tasted lovely by itself and did not need to be hidden behind sauce although the chipotle espresso bbq sauce it came with was also very tasty. My friends and I agreed that I "won" dinner since I ordered the best dish. My only qualm was that my shoestring fries were a little soggy and not as crispy as I would have preferred. But that's very minor.

We were all pretty full, but could not pass up dessert. Like the rest of their menus, the dessert menu had a lot of tasty-sounding options. After some rock/paper/scissors, we ended up ordering the stout ice cream sandwiches which is more like four round brownie patties a la mode. But by all means, if you really wanted to, I guess you could try to eat it ice cream sandwich style. The alcohol in the chocolate stout ice cream wasn't very strong. Both the ice cream and the brownies were stellar. My friends especially loved the brownies. I was wondering what they did with the remaining brownie part after cutting out the rounds (to, you know, save waste if need be), and our waitress told us that the remainder is used for their chocolate martini? Maybe I'll check that out next time. Oh, and also, our waitress was very nice and friendly too. Overall, good service, clean place, nice decor.. everything was great. After tips, came out to ~$30/person, but actually filling up me + two guys  does require a bit of food and drink. 

I'm already trying to think of when I will return to try the kobe burger..
The food is kinda greasy. Not as expected. I have had Destihl in other cities, they were better than this one in Champaign.
Awesome fried bacon, salad and main dish worth it for non vegan gluten person selection smaller for those items and not nearly as fun

I had heard about this place about 6 months before I tried it out, and I'm mad at myself for missing out for so long. The food is affordable for a student on a budget, and the atmosphere is perfect for a date or group outing. It's the perfect place for students to bring their visiting parents, too.
The beer comes in sizes ranging from 4oz to 16oz, so you can try different brews if you're in the mood for that. The Tomato & Bread salad is absolutely phenomenal, and I have added chicken to it and had that as my entree on more than one occasion. This is one restaurant I really miss since graduating U of I and leaving the area.

I am a fan of the vibes here and their appetizers! We got the fried asparagus, cheese curds, and pretzels and they were delicious! However, I would say that their main dishes are eh. Got the pesto pasta and a pizza.

I just really don't think Destihl is that great. We tried them when they first opened years ago and I remember not caring for them. Wanted to give them another try and was just as disappointed as before. Beer was okay. Nothing special. But the food just was not that good. The sausage on my pizza was overtly fatty tasting and didn't have much flavor except for grease. The dates were solid as rocks and barely had any flavor. The decor also makes you feel like you're in the lobby of a hotel chain. It also took forever to get our drinks, and they weren't that busy. I just am not a fan of this place and won't be going back again.

I was blown away by this oasis of fantastic flavor.  The grilled stuffed pasta was so mind-bendingly delicious that I tried to recreate this at home.  While the description and use of two sauces sounds like it would contradict itself, each of the components blend marvelously in your mouth.

I sampled soups and small bites as well.  Over all, I found the flavors in each dish are well balanced and don't compete for attention.  There is a certain finesse that's being used in the kitchen to render distinctly memorable flavor profiles.  

The atmosphere was inviting, modern and clean.  The service staff knowledgeable and attentive.  I wish I had one where I live and will absolutely be back when I find myself in Champaign again.

Loved the weekend brunch menu! Lots of different choices instead of the basic eggs and bacon. I had the skillet and it was delicious. We had a reservation and we were seated immediately upon arriving. Waiter was very attentive. It did talke a long time to get our food but it was worth the wait!

The key to getting to eat here is to have a reservation. Last year we came with a reservation once and without another time. When we did not have a reservation we were simply turned away even though we could see tons of empty tables.

Recently we left the game early and called them from the parking lot at 2:45 and made a reservation for 3:15. We were promptly escorted to a roomy booth which really worked out because other people ended up joining us. 

We had to wait for a while for the other people to show up and the staff was very amenable to it, acted like that was just fine. They even held back our entree order until they got there.

We liked the deviled eggs for the appetizer, they were really good. I had the chili which was very disappointing, I wouldn't get it again. My wife and I split the Cubano sandwich which was Okay.

Nice big space, great staff and if you have a reservation, great place.  But the food is kindof college town fare which the space is not. 

Too bad as last time we were here the food was better.

The first time I went to Destihl, I sat in the dining room; things were okay.  The next time, and every time since, I have sat at the bar; things were remarkable.  I enjoy having the direct interaction with the team of wonderfully skilled bartenders.  Their attention to detail and good cheer make the bar a must for anyone I take out in Champaign.  

The roasted peanuts covered in delectable spices and drizzled with fresh lime juice make the perfect accoutrement to the always great, fresh beer; the bbq burger is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had.

First of all, I found a short black hair in my leftovers (I have long blonde hair). Disgusting and completely unsanitary. 

Second, the food is decent, but overrated. The steaks are OK. The service is OK. And for being one of the most popular restaurants in town, it should be much better quality, both in terms of service and food. 

Save your $ and go to Seven Saints instead. Also never had a hair in my food there...

We have been to Destihl several times. I've heard beer enthusiasts say that their brewery and beers aren't that great, but the food more than makes up for it. Everything I've ordered has been great, and the service is spot-on. I've gone with just my husband, larger groups of adults, and have also gone with the kids. It's been smooth sailing no matter the size or composition of the group. Their kids menu is broader than most, which is nice. The regular menu offers unique dishes that have always enjoyed. I would definitely recommend it.

3.5 Stars

I certainly like Destihl, but I'm not quite in love with it. I was mentally writing my review all throughout dinner, and it was a solid 4 stars--until the bill came. Don't get me wrong, I am happy to pay for amazing food, but it's gotta be spot-on. 

Our dinner for 2 was $120, after tip. We had 2 drinks each, an appetizer, two entrees, and a dessert. I've definitely paid this much before for a comparable amount of food, but that was at some of my favorite restaurants that make sure every detail is perfect. 

And everything at Destihl was good, but not perfect.

Here's what we had:
--Stuffed dates - These had a great sweet/salty/spicy balance, but the barbecue sauce was a bit too much and a little detracting.
--Mustard-glazed chicken - The chicken itself was delicious, but there was too much mustard sauce. The fingerling potatoes and green beans were both good, but not well-seasoned. The dish also didn't come out super hot.
--Espresso-rubbed steak - The steak was huge and cooked well, and it had great flavor. Not my favorite steak, but still good. 
--Bruleed banana pudding - They made this gluten-free for me by not having pie crust, and it was phenomenal. It was the star of the show! I am still dreaming of this.

The interior of Destihl is very nice--what you'd expect at an upscale gastropub. Our server was also very nice, but he was a bit new and didn't quite know the menu well yet.

While I'm not head over heals for this place, I do think it's a great addition to the downtown Champaign scene! I would definitely come back the next time I'm in the city... especially for that banana pudding.

This is now my favorite restaurant in Champaign, followed by O'Charley's and TGI Fridays.  The food here is simply delicious and the atmosphere is wonderful.  Try the 
Thai Fried Chicken, spicy and incredibly good.  The food is good, the wait staff is friendly and the location is ideal.   I simply love Destihl and I didn't even mention the great variety of beers.  Oh, I just did.

I have eaten at Destihl several times - it is consistently pretty good, occasionally exceptional, and rarely subpar.  The staff is always really nice, they are almost aggressive about refilling soda (glasses rarely get to empty, and aren't left empty for more than a minute or two!), reservations and parking are easy, the booths are comfy, and there are some really good items on the menu (Cuban sandwich, the burgers, the ancho chicken, and the huevos rancheros are great; the deep fried bacon can be skipped).

The place located in downtown Champaign has awesome ambience and good food! Though it lies on a little costlier side. The cocktails here are not that good but the main dishes are superb. The pizzas are like regular ones but better taste wise that normal ones. Overall it's one of the best places to go for a date!

I went for lunch with high expectations, and was bitterly disappointed.   I ordered the "choose two," including the pastrami reuben sandwich and the beer cheese soup.   A brew-pub has to have great beer-cheese soup, right?  WRONG!!!!  The soup was like a creamy caraway broth with some green onion garnish.  No taste of cheese or beer, just gross.  The Pastrami Reuben, described as served on Cranberry Nut bread, looked interesting on the menu.  However, what I received was essentially a large cranberry nut scone (about 4" tall) sliced in half with three small pieces of pastrami, a few shreds of sauerkraut, and invisible swiss cheese.  I normally do not send things back in a restaurant, but this showing was so horrible, I sent it back.  I tried the $13 American Kobe burger instead.  Eh.  It was an average - but by no means worth $13 - burger (think akin to the pre-made patties you find at Sam's Club) and, once again, the bread-to-meat ratio was WAY off.   Anyway, $40 later, we walked out very disappointed.  I can think of several places in town I could go and spend much less for a much higher quality experience.

Occasionally, very rarely if truth be told, one finds oneself in Champaign, home of University of Illnois at Urbana-Champaign Campus and gateway to the high plains. It is one of those lovely little Midwestern university towns where one could spend a nice life far from the cut and thrust of city life. 

When in Champaign, one could do worse than to eat at Destihl. The place is modern brew pub of the sort that was popular in the late 90s in fleshpots like San Francisco. Get their flight, it is quite good. The Amber is sweet and floral. They serve nice gastro pub fare. I had the fish (of some sort) that was quite nice. Mid-west prices. 

Sit on the corner patio in front of Destihl, sipping their beer and watching the sunset on downtown Champagne. Good times.

(Whew! So snobby!)

Let me say this: never have I gone to a brew-pub and felt comfortable ordering a burger medium-rare. Destihl has changed all that.

Destihl knows what they're doing. Great food, well prepared, attentive and quick service.

I would give them 6 stars, but my brother at my leftover half of Kobe burger without asking, and I associate that somewhat traumatic experience with Destihl.

A friend recommended I stop by here for the deep fried bacon, and another friend told me all the appetizers here are amazing. Since I got to come here with a large group from work, I got to try the cheese curds and the deep fried bacon. The cheese curds were above average and the deep fried bacon was really good. 

I was worried coming in that the bacon would be a grease bomb, but they executed it really well: thick cut bacon with minimal batter. The maple sauce on top was a nice touch. It came together to show off the delicious flavor of excellently prepared, thick bacon.

For my entree I ordered the cubano, which came with a side of picked cucumbers, onions, and maybe some vegetable I'm forgetting. The cubano was good, and these pickled veggies were amazing. They were perfectly tangy. I would come here more often except most of the time I go out to eat with my kids.

We were here over the weekend and its a really nice spot, we didn't really order food, except for some garlic bread which was cool. We went there for their beer since afterall, they are a brewery. $1.25 for 4oz beers....you can try close to everything they brew and then some. I had 6 and my bf had 5, our bill was just under $20. They had pumpkin ale, hefeweizen, chocolate cherry, coffee beer, IPA's...too many to remember, you'll have to check it out yourself. Can't wait to go back and maybe try some things on their menu. Fun bartender too, ask for Mike!

Destihl (a play on De Stijl? no idea) is an inconsistently passable restaurant with a nice line of beers. They're also a brewery, if you're into that sort of thing, and my experience has been that the waitstaff are very helpful and knowledgeable when it comes to the stuff on tap.

So if you like the idea of a flight of carefully-selected brews and tasty (if not slightly overpriced) appetizers appeals, stop by.

Don't bother with sitting down for dinner. I've limped out of dinner here maybe five times in the past several years. Some reviewers described the food as 'delicious' (they are wrong); a few others as 'inconsistent' or 'not great' (correct). As a purveyor of hastily-prepared American slow food, Destihl is unremarkable, and the breadth of their menu probably suffices to describe the care that each dish has received. Some dishes are actually quite nice, if still too expensive, but you're unlikely to know which are worth your time unless you've got a secret decoder ring or something.

If you're looking to blow some cash on food downtown, think about what kind of food you really want. You're likely to get the same (or a similar) dish done better somewhere else. It's like a rich man's Applebees -- the food is better dressed and the ambience is less "shopping mall," but your wallet hurts more than it should and your tongue is left just as wanting.

Oh, and if you ignore the rest of my advice, don't ignore this: don't get the big chocolate cake for dessert. It is the most over-sized lump of grocery store crap I've ever tasted. Its spot on the dessert menu is downright insulting.

Living in downtown Chicago & having great restaurants right outside our door, it's hard to get really jazzed about another restaurant. Unable to find anything like Distihl with it's interesting, well executed menu & drinks. We've come to expect a great meal at our visits but this time our server, Luis, was an extraordinary compliment to the overall experience with his fun personality & great suggestions. This is a great place to eat dessert first, banana cream pie is awesome and you'll want to have room for every delicious forkful!

Despite seeming to serve vegetarian needs this place fails to be vegan friendly. You can get one entree and two partial meals that are vegan. They have a vegan burger with a non-vegan bun. Does that make sense on any planet? Same with the portobello sandwich. Crazy. 

The food is good but vegans don't bother. They don't get it.
Good atmosphere, food and service.  They were very accommodating for allergies.  I loved this place and I would return

Legitimate spot for vegan/gluten-free food and local brews/craft cocktails.

Beer-battered asparagus = not gluten-free. I risked the intestinal distress, swallowed a GlutnGo pill and gave it a shot. Super delicious maple chipotle sauce! The asparagus stalks were thick and cooked to perfection.

Berries & Goat Cheese Salad (minus goat cheese) = vegan and gluten-free. I think this dish loses charm without the cheese because it was a bit flat. But next time I'll ask to add fresh red onion and that might kick it up a notch. Still, it's a good salad.

The Herbivore (veggie burger, minus mayo) = not gluten-free due to the wheat bun. Huge burger with a great patty, although I tasted just a little too much mint in it. Came with large, thick potato wedges. Great dish.

Sake lemon drop martini was sweet and refreshing. Maybe it's just my tolerance, but I would have liked it to be stronger.

Flight of beer (not gluten-free) including Drunken Weasel, I Believe You Have My Stapler, Roadblock Red Ale and a few others I've forgotten. I sampled each one (thanks to that GlutnGo pill) and they were all quite good. My favorite was the Drunken Weasel. I'm sure I'll visit this place again to re-sample and familiarize myself.

I love this place! The food is great. The bacon mac and cheese is amazing, and so is the jambalaya, meatloaf, pizza, pretzals, and fish and chips. Every dish I have had from here has been good! Would recommend, but they are usually pretty busy, especially on the weekend for dinner-- so make a reservation if you can!
Beer battered asparagus is a many must! I had the yummy scallops and curried mash potatoes and my bf had the bonein rib eye....both were great! Our sever was friendly and knew the menu well.

This is our favorite restaurant in town. Was glad we were staying for the night so we could return. I wish I could try everything on the menu. Eating light tonight decided to both order the corn chowder which is the best we have ever had anywhere.  Our server Curtis was exceptional! So informative and helpful. Finished with their great carrot cake.  It is huge! Those at the front could have been a little bit more organized and friendly.  Love the atmosphere here too. Parking is free with validation...the attendant is not very helpful and hardly looks up from his cellphone to acknowledge someone entering.  We hope to return when in the area. again.

The waitress and hostess were super friendly.  Waitress recommended lots of options (her favorite salad, pizza, app, sandwich, etc) and beers. I went with a strawberry ale, cheese curds and the greekish salad.  The beer was excellent - fruity and light!  The cheese curds were great but the more you ate, the more blah you felt...share with someone!  The greekish salad was weird...it had a red dressing that I didn't like at all.  Bill came to $19.  A little pricey for lunch but not outrageous.

First of all, we got there at 2:50 and they told us we could only sit in the bar area at the high tables because they were going to having a shift change in about 15 minutes.  Other people had to wait also, they should seat people and have management pick up until waitstaff can.  Food was just ok.  We had the asparagus appetizer,  tasted good,  would be better with a spicy dip, the wait person never came back for us to ask.  I had the wagyo grass fed burger, was just ok, tasted funny to me.  Potato wedges were burnt , regular fries were good. I might go there again but would seriously think about it considering the cost.

I think this is the best valued food in champaign. Almost everything I've  ever gotten has been full of flavor and delicious- from pizzas to soup and sandwiches and great local meat entrees. Their beer is decent, nothing extraordinary, but they have other beer options besides their own.

Great place with an excellent menu!  We were sat near the kitchen and enjoyed viewing all of the wonderful dishes being served.  My husband said the beer battered bacon egg burger exceeded his high expectations.  I ordered the flat iron steak with asparagus and blue cheese potatoes.  Excellent flavor and Not a ton of food which is what I was wanting.  Kids enjoyed their meals, but it would be nice if they jazzed up the kids choices a bit.

good food, small portions.  Fairly over priced for what you get.  A little on the gourmet side as well.

All in all, i'd like to try more on the menu, i had the bbq glazed chicken and it was good, not great, thus only 3 stars for Distihl.

Would love to see some blackened items added to the menu, like a fish or a chicken.

My family and I have been to this establishment about three times, today, for a family members birthday was the most disappointing experience. We ordered the pretzel appetizer which was overdone like last time. Then one member of our party wanted to order a pizza with pineapple which they have done every time we've eaten there, and the waitress said that she would talk to the chef but if they did it before it shouldn't be a problem. When our food FINALLY arrive, her pizza had a tiny amount of pineapples in addition to onion, when we filled the waiter in she said that was the mix they used for their burgers so it had to come with onions, which she did not disclose when ordering, if she had we would have ordered something else. thankfully, my daughter was not allergic to onions considering they didn't say the pineapple pizza would be coming with onions. Then the waitress seemed bothered by us pointing it out with an tone and irritated face. Then we tried to doa nice birthday desert for someone, and unlike any other restaurant they said they would only put a candle on a desert if we bought one and that they would not be singing happy birthday and it wasn't allowed. Cool thanks!!!

The warm potato and salmon dish is delicious! I had a great dining experience with a group of friends at Destihl. Their menu includes various options for vegan, gluten free, and even the most carnivorous of diners which is difficult to find in one restaurant. I only wish that they were open later in the evening!

OK so each time I have gone back to Destihl since my original post it has been better. I'd like to think someone over there read my posts ;) I'm still not a fan of the price points but the food is far more consistent and seems to be better quality. Also really enjoy their coffee and fresh cream after any meal there. Still nothing terribly interesting however everything seems fresh and well executed. Also I am trying to tone down on being such a food snob so... 4 stars!! (throws confetti sarcastically)
I've not had the beer but the food is delicious! The warm caramel sundae is something straight out of heaven!
Slow service, weak food, im not sure the beers we ordered had any alcohol in them they tasted watered down.  The place looks promising but I was dissapointed.
I was staying at a hotel across the street so this was a convenient place for dinner.  I got a reservation no problem.  I had the pulled pork and the fried cheese curds.  Delicious!
Food was ok beer was great. only had one appetizer that was a fried cheese curd. Outside was hot but inside was clod. Service was great
Bloody Marys were great, stuffed dates were spicy yet delicious, Mango IPA yum! Wait staff worked together well. An exceptional experience for a first time visit!

The best burgers ever! I've only been here for lunch and always get the Wagyu burger. I don't like my burgers to have a ton of stuff on them because I like to taste the meat. One: they know how to cook meat "medium" (it's still slightly pink and perfect). Two: the meat tastes AMAZING! Whatever they do this is probably some of the best meat I've tasted. Tasty beer (they brew their own plus it's not over-carbonated) and the service is really good. Usually I don't really care about service but all of the service we've gotten from this place is setting the bar. The servers actually know what they are doing and what they are serving--plus they're all good looking! I absolutely love this place. Remember to bring your growlers because you can also purchase some of that yummy beer for later.

We had such a wonderful experience. Raul was our server and couldn't have been more helpful. Wasn't sure what to expect but our party of 6 all left very happy. Would go back again but our so graduated. Wish I had know about this great place and Raul sooner.

The positive:  The Aztec chocolate martini comes with a brownie garnish.  And it's spicy.  
The waiters and bartenders I've talked to have been incredibly friendly.
The food's better than you'd expect, actually.  The salad was good, which is maybe not what you'd expect from a place that labels itself a brew pub.  The pizza's a little boring, but that's probably just the vegetarian ones I'm limited to.  They serve continuously, they have a large cocktail list, they take my American Express... it's everything a burgeoning yuppie alcoholic could want in a brew pub.
Except that's not really me so here's what I don't like.
The atmosphere.  As I read through the descriptions they say "oh the atmosphere is great!" and I say... are you at the same restaurant?  It's what a corporate design team thinks of as good atmosphere.  Large, airy, and completely devoid of personality.  It matches Jim Gould's across the street very well actually.
The whole place really just reeks of chain, and I don't think that bothers most people at all but if I want to go in by myself and have a late lunch I feel very awkward.  I'm happy to go in with friends and have cocktails and split a pound of cake.  (They actually inform me that it is an 11 pound cake split 10 ways, so slightly more than a pound!)

Worth checking out, if for no other reason than you too have probably been watching them work on this place for a couple years.  You can't NOT go.

Came here on a not so busy weeknight and tried their beer battered asparagus and their fried egg and bacon burger. Both were extremely delicious. It took a good minute for the burger to come out and I was stuffed from the asparagus for when it finally did. The asparagus was extremely tasty. The burger was very flavorful and I had leftovers which tasted almost as good the next day. Love that you can get 4oz of any of their beer- I forgot which ones I tried but can't wait to come back for more!
Creative and delicious! Everything off the menu is incredible and beer selection is incredible! A wonderful place for both family night and date night.
Very nice place.  Large interesting menu with many different things.  Love the stuffed poblano peppers!
Great food, nice atmosphere!  Have the weissenheimer chicken, shaved Brussels sprout salad and pumpkin bread pudding!  Delicious!  Fun place too!

This place is FANTASTIC! We came on a Friday night, probably one of their busiest. We called ahead for reservations (highly recommended) and only waited at the bar for only 20 minutes. The beer selection is wonderful and they taste great; I had the mango IPA and it was mind blowing!


Our server Aaron was incredibly professional and knowledgeable; he confidently and accurately described every item on the menu we asked about. 

I had the beer battered jalape√±o bacon and fried egg prime beef burger. Mouth orgasm! So good. 

My wife and her cousin were born and raised in this area. They proclaimed with confidence that this is the best restaurant in the area I couldn't agree more. Try this place!!

Limited menu for vegetarians and overall a pretty unhealthy menu. It has a lively atmosphere which can be fun for groups, but if you have a large party I recommend booking the private party room so you can actually hear each other. This place is best for business meals.

Went for dinner and sat on the patio which was wonderful because there was a band playing on the corner. Our food was very good, but the best part was the coffee and dessert! Our waiter recommended the sour cherry bread pudding and it was awesome. Our waiter was great too. Despite them being extremely busy, he was very attentive and very helpful!

Food is great and the staff are great.
The only down side is the wait time.
I have been here four times now; during their on and off busy hours. I have had to wait at least 45 minutes for food everytime. Is it worth the wait? Eh.
The four times I came here were for date nights with my boyfriend and we have other events planned as well. With the time spent waiting at Destihl, we would usually miss our movie or a dessert place we planned to go to would close by the time we are done eating. I would rather go somewhere where the wait time is shorter and be able go some place elsewhere after dinner.
The food is delicious but not enough having to wait for it in my opinion.

went here twice, got pizza the first time, ribs the second. The pizza is quite satisfying and good if you order it, I would recommend that over the ribs. The ribs were kinda mediocre, but they were still decent, but not worth the price. 

Got a bunch of beers both times I went, they have rotating beers and home brewed beers that stay. None of them were that special.

It is a nice place though, waitress and atmosphere is more on the refine side.

Our server was super helpful (and patient) as we decided what beers we'd like for our flights. The standout for me was the white stout. I didn't even know such a thing existed! I think I'm in love. The food was a little baffling; for all of their "boycott bland," I was a little befuddled as to how everything I tried was so...bland. The shrimp ceviche, the asparagus and lemon risotto, the salmon I added to it, even the lemon berry cream cake. I added salt and pepper, which helped, but I don't usually go out to eat and drop a bunch of money to have food that's just seasoned with salt and pepper. They have a lot of things on their menu that sound interesting, but when I weigh the risk with the price, maybe I'll just go back for beer and another one of their starters.

Great service! Couldn't even finish a drink before they had another on the table. 
Food was excellent!! I got the salmon and potatoes, my brother got the pot roast. 
We don't live in the area, stopped in on our way through town...it was out of the way but totally worth the extra time on the road. 
Highly recommend this restaurant!
