Went here with a friend for a beer flight and dinner last night, we loved it! The restaurant inside is very spacious and modern. Our server was incredibly nice and knew a lot about the beer selection, he was very helpful when we were picking our flights. We got flights of 5 each - they were very yummy and very inexpensive!! We then decided to split the bacon date pizza, which was nothing short of amazing. It was perfect for the two of us to split and had a great salty/sweet thing happening. Would definitely recommend that dish! Relatively inexpensive for yummy food and drink and great service. I will absolutely come back when I visit again!

Brilliant. The staff was super friendly, the atmosphere was awesome, and the food was spectacular. I ordered the Thai fried chicken. It was literally a half a chicken on top of a bed of some yummy, spicy rice. I loved it. Ordered the fried asparagus for appetizer. The waitress was very informative and was spot on with suggesting the dishes. I absolutely recommend this place for first timers.

I don't know many people that like Destihl. I think it's a nice, relaxed place to go for different cuisine than you would find a chain restaurant plus they have some pretty stellar brews. The beer changes often, so don't fall in love with anything. I've had my heart broken more than once by their ever-changing menu. The plus side is I'm forced to try something new when they switch things up. Destihl is a nice spot to go to relax and have a drink. They have a small selection of small plates that are interesting and mostly good. I've never had bad service here and love the fact that they validate parking!

We went here for my friends birthday and the food was very average. My friends had the fish tacos and claimed they were extremely dry. I had the veggie burger and it was also extremely dry. Overall the food lacked flavor and honestly aesthetic as well. Probably would not go here again.

My wife and I are from Chicago and our friends from the area introduced us to Distihl.  It was a busy Saturday night and the service was a bit slow but given that we weren't in a rush, that was OK.  The food exceeded my expectations.  I had the Cuban sandwich and one of the better Cubans I've had in a long time!  My wife and friend both had a pasta dish which they enjoyed.  The waiter also was very knowledgeable about the menu and large number of beer choices, all of which were excellent too.  There are lots of choices in Champaign and I recommend anyone try Distihl!
Food was great, service was excellent.  Atmosphere was perfect for a nice evening out!  I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
Good ambiance ,  kids like the place and familiar menu choices. Excellent food presentation but sometimes food comes out a little bland and not as flavorful. Still, a good place to go.

This restaurant is expensive but definitely worth it for a special occasion. Great appetizers and entrees. The mixed drinks are incredible - try the saki lemon drop martini, it's amazing. 
The service is great. The food is great. For celebrations, my first thought is always destihl.
Sadly I wanted this place to be 4 stars, but fell short based on the chicken and dumplings. Overly salty sauce with dry chicken. Beer selection was good and service was attentive.

My daughter had heard good things about Destihls, so we decided to give it a try.  We went on a Saturday night (12/1/12), so the place was pretty busy.  Fortunately, I was able to get a reservation through OpenTable via Yelp, so getting in was no problem.

When we arrived, we were seated within 30 seconds.  I appreciate that efficiency - we also saw several groups that tried the walk-in route - Lesson Learned - use the Yelp reservation system for fast seating!

We ordered the home-made chips for an appetizer, and they were great.  Very tasty, and a malt vinegar sauce, as well as a spicy sauce.

This place makes and serves it's own beer.  if you want a Bud Light, you'll have to go elsewhere.  If you want to try their beer, the prices are quite honestly, very low for good beer.  We tried their 4 ounce beers (I know, so small, but since you're trying a store brew, do I really want 16 ounces I don't like after one sip?) and for $1 and $1.50 (the price range of a 4 ounce beer), we got 2 beers that were very palatable and very good.

On to dinner. The menu ranges from sandwiches to steaks to pizza.

I ordered the 8 ounce Sirloin, medium rare.  The steak was cooked properly, more importantly, it was seasoned properly, and tasted great.  It was more tender than some fillets I have had recently.  A+!

My wife ordered a pork roast dish, that had pork so tender you didn't need a knife.  She really liked the dish.

My daughter went with the 8 ounce burger, and was very impressed.  She ordered it medium rare, and it was cooked to order.  She loved it.

My son ordered one of the pizzas, and was a little surprised when a large, thin crust pizza arrived (pleasantly surprised - he was expecting a lot less.)  The pizza was great.

We ordered desert, which included carrot cake (we ordered 1 piece for 2 people, and it was the right choice - very heavy, very good), along with S'mores and a Neopolitan fruit dish, all of which were very good.

The only reason this isn't getting 5 stars is the noise level - the interior is nicely appointed, and very well done, but the acoustics are not very good.  Lots of hard surfaces result in a loud restaurant, where it was hard to hear our server.

We'll be back.  The entire ticket with tip was less than $110 for four adults.

Food is absolutely delicious and comes at a great price. For what I pay - maybe $10-$15 for a dish - I get a dish I would expect to cost closer to $30. Appetizers, entrees, and desserts alike are all delectable; I never have enough room in my stomach for all I want to eat. The restaurant has a nice in-between feeling, the sort of type where it could be dressed up or dressed down. I've been here before for brunches and lunch with friends as well as for slightly more formal dinner outings.

This restaurant has below average/overpriced food, and ridiculously slow service.. It took about 15-20 minutes for anyone to even notice us. We had to flag someone down just for some waters. I wouldn't say the servers did know what they were doing, but just very slow. For a Monday night, business was okay, but waiting 40 minutes for food is inexcusable. 

I had the Beer Battered Bacon Burger with an Egg, and it was below average. It would have been your average burger if the patty had any flavor.. But the meat was simply tasteless. The beer battered bacon is quite tasty, but the nothing I would crave for. 

The only reason I give this place two stars is for the Strawberry Ale that I got to try. The beer was light and smooth, it complimented my meal. 

I would go back to have a drink or two, but not for a dinner out with family or friends.
Favorite restaurant in Champaign! Great for brunch, lunch and dinner. Also they have an amazing gluten free menu if that is something you're into.

Seriously one of my top 3 favorite restaurants around here! I haven't had a single dish here that I didn't absolutely love. The appetizers are super good also. The pretzels are SO freaking good, I love the mustard that comes with them even more than the cheese. Can't go wrong with their burgers and fries BUT if you wanna try something a little more "Destihl" the Chilaquiles was AWESOME! They put a nice twist on a traditionally hispanic dish, the goat cheese is a nice touch. The stuffed Poblano peppers are my girlfriends favorite! I also thoroughly enjoy the four cheese mac and cheese for a "grown up" dish from your childhood!
Can you say BEER BATTERED BACON??!!!  Fried cod is to die for and Kobe burger is awesome!
Great service. Great food. Appetizers came a little late, but the owner made the apps on the house and personally delivered. Recommend the beer battered asparagus and poblano pepper entree.

In my opinion a good brewpub has great beer with good food to accompany the beer.  Maybe it iwas the fact that we checked it out 4 days after it opened, but of the 5 beer styles we got, 4 of them were "off".  One was clearly oxidized (badly), one was infected to lacto and tasted very funy and the other two mildly oxidized.  We hoped the manager would come visit with us, but no luck.  The bartender indicated that depending on the time of day, the beer tastes different from the yeast.  First time I have heard of that.  Food was decent, but I have had better pub grub.  Maybe the beer just ruined my taste buds.  

(Positive) The pizza is HUGE .  .enough for two to share or one very hungry person.

Hopefully they figure things out.  Have been frequently brewpubs throughout the US in the last 12 years and can honestly say it was the oxidized beer and infect beer were the worse I have ever had.  Even my earliest botched homebrews were not that "off".  Gave it two stars since it was the first week it was open and the possibilities it was growing pains.

Nice spot for drinks and food. Second time visiting this place. The first time I had a bad cold so I really couldn't enjoy the food. 
The brew is on point with a good in house selections. The mixed drinks are done very well; you can't go wrong with any of them. And the wine list is great; not many places carry Chenin Blanc and Cab Franc. Both of these wines are great!

The food was amazing especially the cheese curds and beer battered bacon. The flat iron was very good and I have had the pizza as well. The pizza was good but not great; stone oven but I was hoping for a more crispy crust. But it's still worth ordering. 

The deserts seemed very good but I have not tried them. But I'm sure you can't go wrong with trying them. 

Overall this is a very nice place with great ambience  and plenty of drink choices.

I'm a big fan of taking out of towners to this place.  They have a variety of good dishes and a great list of homemade brews.  If you dig spice, I would highly recommend their stuffed pepper.  One is plenty of food.  However, if if you want another meal, you can capitalize on economies of scale and order two.  I think the second one is like 5 bucks cheaper or so.  

The restaurant is spacious and has a semi formal atmosphere.   Plus, they take reservations.  All the more reason it is good for out of towners.

Always happy when I go there. Great beer selection, great food selection, and great service. The only reason it's not 5 stars in my book is because the main dining room still kinda feels like a big chainy restaurant, and I'm more of a fan of independent ones.

My review is for today's visit. In town on business and Destihl was recommended. Service was very good as we fumbled through the beer and food menu.  I had the Hefeweizen, Jacobs ladder brown, and Roadblock red beers, all good.  Tried the battered bacon appetizer, perfect. So many great sounding entrees, I picked the pot roast - excellent. Very tender and tasty beef, gravy with vegetables on top of mashed potatoes. Excellent. Prices are reasonable. I wish we had this place in Wisconsin.
Great beer great food and great service.  Check out the bottled selection as well as the draft.   Servers were awesome....thanks Chris!

I just found out that Destihl doesn't have a dedicated fryer for their french fries and other "gluten-free" offerings. And they have stopped offering a GF menu. They were obviously trying to cater to the trendy gluten-free crowd, but not to Celiacs.

I'm very passionate about the stuffed peppers that come with chicken and/or chorizo and mashed potatoes. They're amazing. Warning: they're quite spicy, but I might think this because I paired this dish with a Bloody Mary last time which was also spicy. Either way, I enjoyed both and would order the same combo again. No regrets.

I love sitting on the patio when it's nice out. I once saw Jason Segel walk by during Ebertfest so that made for some exciting dinner conversation. Even when Jason isn't strolling by, there's a lot to look at and it's in a nice central, downtown location.

I've eaten here for brunch, lunch, and dinner and every time it rocks. 

Good to know: when it's someone's birthday, they bring out the cutest s'mores dessert dish (easy to share with friends! Or not). They also make amazing carrot cake.

Not too crowded at 12am on a weekend.
Found a table, whew, and the waiter was very helpful.  He knew quite a bit about drinks, their beers, and the menu.

He was attentive and answered all our questions patiently.  Patience is a virtue to a bar customer because time is money for them, and I get that.

The only thing I remember ordering was the deep fried bacon.  MMMMMMMM  It had a bit of spice to it and they were great...just taxing on the tummy 30 minutes after eating it.  Sooooo much grease - but aren't things better that way?

Lots of interesting menu choices and in house brewed beers (which I didn't have)
Hope you try them.

Loved the bacon dates appetizer! And the cheese curds.  I had the three cheese soup and the half of  Cuban sandwich and liked both.    The side house salad I ordered was fresh and had a light house dressing.  Some of  of our family had burgers and all were happy with the meal.  One of us had 
the Thai noodles and liked it.  We all shared pumpkin bread pudding with pecan ice cream for desert and it was delicious.  It is very clean and has a nice atmosphere.  Pretty reasonably priced for a family of 5!

Came on a Thursday evening. Waited for 20 minutes when there was an abundance of open tables, my guess is they were short on wait staff that evening and wanted to keep the sections manageable. I won't fault them for that. I had the pot roast, it was very salty and the potatoes that accompanied it were a little clumpy. The portion size was average, kind of a bummer. We had the pretzel as an appetizer and it was great. But I mean come on it's just a pretzel, it would be pretty hard to mess that up. Service was okay, pretty quick to refill drinks, and the bill was affordable. I don't know this place screams average to me, I know there are other items on the menu that are probably worth writing home about, I unfortunately didn't have one of them. If you are in the area and you are looking for nice decor, not a chain, and moderately priced food this place should be on your list. Not great, but okayish to good.

Real good food along with exceptional service, good place for casual dining... Best of all were a trio of Beef Filets that were the best I have ever had, tender, flavorful, exceptional quality meat... Burgers were a hit with the kids who wrestled today.... Beer we tried were great! Service was top notch.. Very pleasant dining experience.. Can't wait to go back!

After a long work day, my friend J and I needed some booze and sustenance... and she came up with yet another Champaign winner!

Interior is stylish, minimal and dark.  Our booth was large and comfy.  Our waiter was knowledgeable and just friendly enough.  Can quickly become pricey if you stay a while and dive into the small plates and drinks.

I was overwhelmed by the drink menu and ended up going with my old standby, the dirty Martini.  My first one with organic corn vodka, which made for a smooth sipping drink.  Loved it.  J tried two different drinks (so I got to try them too) over the course of our dinner, both of which were delicious and pleasantly spiked with liquor.

We tried two different apps - the Beer Battered Bacon and the House Olives (our 2nd choice when we were told they'd just run out of the deviled eggs).  The bacon was not greasy at all, and the maple chipotle drizzle was the perfect topper.  The olives were meh, just not necessary - and I don't think my opinion was swayed too much by the fact that I really, really wanted those deviled eggs!

Next up, a la carte soup.  I went with the Beer & Cheddar soup, which was close to great with discernible beer and cheese flavors.  J chose the soup du jour, Cream of Asparagus - excellent fresh asparagus flavor here.  Both soups were wonderfully creamy.  Bowls were decent-sized for $5.

My entree was a Thai shrimp and noodle dish (I'm a sucker for coconut curry sauces).  Nice amount of shrimp, but no noticeable spice to the dish.  A bit of a disappointment.  J's beer-brined double pork chop was an amazing dish, not to mention huge.  Perfectly pink pork.

We parked in a nearby parking garage as the lot across the street was full.  I would return and try everything new (other than my Martini).
I love this place from the amazing food to drinks to beer to ambience. This place has it all. The people who work here are wonderful! Love this gastropub

I made a reservation for 7:30pm for a party of 3 and wasn't seated until 8:30pm with no apology from the host. We ordered fish and chips which came with literally only 5 potato wedges and the fish tasted off, almost as if it had sat out too long. The food was overpriced for what we received and I was disappointed at this whole experience. It was my first time here and I don't know if I'll ever return.

WOW- I am really surprised by all of the good reviews of this place!  I have been here twice- both times for lunch. The first time I went with colleagues and two of us ordered soup. It came out cold and had to be sent back. We ordered the cheese curds to share (nothing great) and I had the Chimi Chicken Torta; which was actually pretty bland. 

The second time I went, I ordered the Tomato and Bread salad with chicken. By the name of the salad, you would think it would have tomatoes on it right? I had two little pieces of a tomato, wilted greens, and a couple little tiny balls of mozzarella. Not acceptable. I asked the waitress for more tomatoes and mozzarella and after looking annoyed, she returned with more of each. 

I don't know what others are having that's so great, but I am very unimpressed with this place and will not be returning.

The first few times I dined at Destihl, I wasn't fond of it. I thought the food was too greasy and too salty. That was in regards to the the duck confit (which they don't offer anymore) and the salmon. The next few times I tried a greater of variety of dishes including the fish tacos and a couple burgers and a few appetizers (cheese curds and quesadilla). Excellent. Destihl has really grown on me.

I had really high expectations for this place...I have to say, I was very disappointed. The only reason for a two star rating was the appetizers. We got the pretzels with beer cheese and the deep fried bacon. The pretzels were great, served warm. The bacon was...interesting, but tasty. That is where the goodness ends. I got a cheeseburger and asked for it to be prepared medium...I received a very dry and very well done bland burger with horrible over cooked yet cold potato wedges. The kids meals are ridiculously small and mediocre at best. To add insult to injury...we paid over $100 for a party of 5 (2 were kids meals) for over cooked and cold food. Huge disappointment!

Only okay experience on graduation weekend. They had a lot of trouble managing the bigger crowd-- service was slow and the wait staff visibly stressed and distracted. The food wasn't great either. I ordered their very decadent-sounding french toast, but it was a bit dry and not especially flavorful... mostly just an eggy bageutte sliced into chunks. This was definitely the weakest of the restaurants we visited during the weekend, but I could see it being a nice place for some beer and burgers on a less crowded evening.

The rueben is awesome.  

The bison burger leaves much to be desired.  It has a very French flavor to it, which just doesn't seem right for bison at all.

The bourbons they have should be better than what they are carrying.
Husband and i went here for lunch. Nice atmosphere. Tables are close but not to close. Server was great and food was even better. I had fun trying a couple different beers. Will definitely return.

I have eaten here probably 15 times, and I've never left disappointed, or even mildly unsatisfied. Almost every dish I've had here was fantastic, with the ones that aren't fantastic being between very good and great. 

If you like soft pretzels, you have to order them as an appetizer. I've gone and picked up their pretzels with cheese and mustard sauce to go many times. 

The venue is great for casual dining or special celebrations. I've had great experiences in the dining room and sitting in the bar area. Spend some time looking over the beer menu. You won't be disappointed in that category either, I promise.

WHAT THE HECK IS THAT NASTY SMELL?

I'm not kidding.  I walked in the front doors today for lunch and would've turned around if I wasn't in a bit of a time crunch and needed to just order and eat already.  The entire restaurant smelled like somebody hid a bucket of crab legs and forgot where they put it......last week.  Just about the time you thought you might get used to it, you got another wave.  Can you give a negative star for ambiance, because EW.

My server today was super attentive and friendly.  I got there right at 12:30 and the hostess had to seat me in the bar area because the manager just cut ALL the servers in the restaurant section.  They CUT THE SERVERS AT 12:30?  Smack in the middle of lunch?  Who does that?  Fortunately, my bar server (he may have been bartender, too...I wasn't really paying attention to that) was great.  Many thanks to him for great timing on delivery of food and drink and immediate response when the kitchen screwed something up and getting my check out quickly.

I ordered a cup of the soup of the day--an Andouille gumbo--and a half Cuban sandwich.  The sandwich was fine--I've had that before and it's pretty decent for a Cuban in the Midwest, albeit very far from authentic!  But the soup.... there was a layer of fat floating on top of it and now three hours later my tummy is reminding me of that.  It was SO THIN that my first spoonful only brought up broth and a tiny piece of onion and a tiny piece of red pepper.  I asked my server if there was supposed to be rice and he said HECK YEAH and came right back with a tiny ramekin of rice to at least give it a little body.  I finally found a few little cubes of sausage, but suffice it to say that this is NOTHING even close to the gumbo you find anyplace that actually knows how to make it.  I kinda feel like I need to give them my recipe that came straight from my crazy little cajun friend.  Say it with me TASSO HAM, ROUX, TONY CHACHERE'S SEASONING....and don't be so stingy with the sausage!

This is the first time I've been back here in about a year, I would say.  I always really wanted to like this place.  The interior is cute.  I like that they brew beer.  But the food has never been above a hearty meh for me.  I've had so many food issues here--there was the time that I ordered the reuben 1/2 sandwich and soup that literally had ZERO meat on the sandwich and the time the chicken was served raw and the time they forgot to put the primary ingredient on the pizza....  The only reason I came was for the amazing and entertaining service. They cleaned house a year or so ago and all the really good professional servers were gone. (And I know that they did this in a less than classy way...)  Based on today's experience, they still don't have their act together in the kitchen.  And the menu hasn't changed one iota in a year's time, so nothing new is calling my name.

Maybe I'll try them in another year.  Maybe.  There are far too many options in CU to waste my time and money here.  It's a shame to squander the best location in town.
Great place for your family.  The beer battered bacon is tremendous.

Coming from the LA and OC area I was skeptical about how good some of the food in C-U would be in comparison. I'm happy to say that I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed the food and drink here. 

Service was extremely good and attentive. Our server recommended the salmon and potatoes and my god that was a great recommendation. Central Illinois isn't where you expect to find good seafood but the dish was cooked to perfection. Grilled salmon, roasted vegetables, and fingerling potatoes all tied together in a wonderfully light mustard dressing.

I also had the Cranberry Criek Sour and Synchopathic Apricot Sour which were both extremely good. One thing I appreciated was that beer was priced the same per ounce regardless of size, meaning you can taste more of their selection without paying more.

Will definitely be back sometime in the future.

One of the classiest establishments Champaign has to offer. I come here at least once a week for work or events. They have a diverse menu that should please most people. I'd recommend the skirt steak, Dijon chicken, or burgers. The salmon is very popular with my colleagues as well. They also have a rotating drink list that always seems to offer something new and unique.  They take reservations and it usually a good idea, especially on a weekend. 

If you have space in your diet their appetizers are wonderful (bacon wrapped dates!) also for dessert the chocolate cake is worth a bite (then take it home to eat later).

This place has a great atmosphere with outdoor and indoor seating, and I love that you can see where they brew all the beer.

I tried the Hefeweizen and really enjoyed it. I was amazed at how large their menu was. They had a great variety with lots of vegetarian options.

I ended up trying the veggie burger. Overall, I've had better - but it was still very good. And the fries that came with it were awesome. I would recommend it but if I came back I would probably try something else. 

I knocked off a star because our service wasn't great. Our server was also the bartender so he was pretty busy, but still. 

Overall I was very pleased and would definitely go back.
Best restaurant in CU.  The food is always interesting and delicious. Staff is friendly.  We got the beer battered asparagus and that was amazing.  I like their pizzas.
Love the athmosphere.  Plenty of craft brews on tap.  This is a nice place to take a date or have a business meeting.

BEST. CARROT. CAKE. EVER.

One of the few places in Champaign I like going to more than a few times. Never tried their beer because I don't drink beer, which is a shame since their food's good so I bet there are some great pairings! 

Their croquettes, like most fried stuff IMHO, is okay. The stuffed poblano was really nicely done, and has some serious stuffing! The swordfish tacos are amazing; just look at the line up of flavours on the menu! 

I avoid eating pastas in most places, but the orrechhiette and fennel sausage one is great. Always love flavoured sausages, and while I'm not sure this is house-made, it's still a great dish. And even when you re-heat it, except for the kale bits of course :) Their stuffed pasta is good too, but not as much.

Came to destihl for brunch (have been several times for dinner), and they do not disappoint. Started off with beer battered bacon as an appetizer with a delicious Bloody Mary. The brunch menu is small but the frittata and French toast we are were delicious! Will definitely go back!

I was really excited to try Destihl, but unfortunately the experience fell a little flat. My friend and I arrived a little after 7 on a Friday night and was told the wait would be about 40 minutes since we didn't have reservations. No problem. After only about 20-25 minutes our pager buzzed, so score! So far so good. Our server was really nice and attentive, nothing negative to say about him. However, the food is another story.

We started with the cheese curds for an appetizer. And these were awesome, plus they give you a lot. The only part of the meal that really stood out, sadly. I'd had my eye on the strawberry goat cheese salad, so I got that and split the pesto goat cheese pizza. The salad had a lot of potential with all the seemingly good ingredients, but was just off. The spinach tasted wrong and it would have been much better with mixed greens. The "strawberry" part of the salad consisted of maybe three tiny pieces and the goat cheese wasn't even very good. It mainly was made up of mandarin oranges and ill-tasting spinach.

I'm not a huge fan of wood-fired pizza (I prefer almost any other type of crust). My friend and I split a pizza, but I saw plenty of people putting one away all by themselves. It is very thin. The toppings were ok, but I didn't like how the goat cheese was in big globs instead of spread over the whole pizza.

We left without getting dessert, but I saw a few and they are possibly the biggest desserts I've ever seen anywhere. This isn't a good thing. Probably 3-4 people should be splitting on dessert, but I'm guessing that doesn't happen that often. So just be aware if you do order that piece of cake.

Besides the service, the other positive is the price. Everything is fairly cheap. But that coincides with the quality, so just beware.

Destihl is one of my favorite restaurants in Champaign. Their current appetizer special, Thai style chicken wings, is one of the best things I've ever eaten. I hope they'll add it to their menu permanently! I love trying their rotating feature menu and beer list. It's always a tough choice if I want to try something new or go with a classic. Its a win either way. The stuffed peppers and the rest of their house specialties are all just stellar.  The sake lemon drop is awesome, as are their mimosas and other signature cocktails. Really, everything on their menu is great. I love coming here.

To be honest the food was pretty good. I got the chorizo stuffed dates, which was the best thing I had tonight. For my entree I got the wagyu burger, which was overall pretty good. However this is the point at which their rating goes down. 

The wagyu burger is advertised as coming with a "golden brioche bun", but the bun we received looked like the average bun you get at Walmart for a picnic; thin, flat and crumbling. We asked the waitress if there was some mistake but she confirmed that, indeed the bun we received was the "golden brioche bun". Either the waitress was mistaken, or this restaurant does not know what a brioche bun is. I guess it's also possible that I have no idea what a brioche bun should look like. I uploaded a photo of the bun if you guys want to see for yourself.

A very good restaurant that works to accommodate their customers and make sure all are well fed. I enjoy the beer battered bacon it is worth the trip all by itself. A great selection of beer and microbrews. I have had the jambalaya and swordfish the times I went both were descent. Swordfish was a bit dry. It's a good atmosphere on the weekends. A bit dead during the week. All in all a great place to eat.

Appetizer of cheese curds with a smoky garlic red sauce were good...very flavorful. Our 2 1/2 year old enjoyed her yummy PBJ and we were especially appreciative of the fact they offered seasonal fresh fruit as an option. The nice size bowl included mandarin and Sunkist oranges, Apples and strawberries. She also loved the corn and chicken chowder and ate half of her Daddies. My husband ordered the black rye IPA and the red ale. I ordered the porter. We enjoyed them all. Along with the cup of soup, my husband and I shared a half havarti and turkey sandwich on ciabatta bread. The avocado was very fresh and the basil pesto mayo was good too. Our waiter, Tanner was sweet and efficient. The booth was big and comfy. Overall we very much enjoyed lunch here.
Better reserve a table 6 months in advance if you ever want to eat here. Completely empty on Saturday at 5, but no tables for 45 mins to an hour so byyyyeeee.

Nice kinda classy place that has food. You could wear a tie and not feel out of place, but I'm in khakis and a t-shirt and still feel comfortable. We're just ordering beer samples and Curtis is taking care of us nicely. Not a bad blow off Monday workday kind of place.

Good food and good service. I ordered a flat iron steak and mashed potatoes. All was great. Our server was great and knew the menu well. The reason I gave four instead of five is the price to food ratio. You don't get a whole lot of food for the price but to be expected as its a "trendy" restaurant. Would recommend and will be visiting again.

Went here for din-din with my broey and his wifepoo since they live in the area.  Food was fantastic!  Service was spot on - our waitress was very attentive and took great care of us.

We had a flight of the many beers they offer, the menu is extensive and it's hard to decide.  But one thing is 1000% worth getting:  Beer Battered Asparagus.  That's it.  Who cares if you have stinky pee from eating asparagus - totally worth it.

Super excited this place is finally open.  Not only that, but it was just as good as I had hoped it would be.  Tons of good things to say about the place, but I'll start with the two negatives so we can get that out of the way.
The waitress heard me say cheese pizza instead of goat cheese pizza.  Probably my fault actually, because it was loud and I am a self-proclaimed mumbler.  This mistake was fixed promptly and the pesto goat cheese pizza was awesome.  Second problem was that the fried asparagus was somewhat whelming.  It was really big, so if you're going for size great, but smaller spears aren't woody textured like the big spears.  I assume that since they specify they use local when they can, that this problem will remedy itself once asparagus comes into season in a few weeks around here.

Now for the mega good stuff:
Deadhead double red is probably THE BEST red ale I've ever had.  It is strong, spicy, flavorful and full bodied.  Just wonderful!  Everyone at my table liked their other flavors (and we went with some beer snobs ;)  The hubby loved, loved, loved the coffee glazed rib-eye.  Service was surprisingly good granted that it was the first weekend they were open.  The people getting bad service in the other review...sorry, we must've been hogging all the attention ;).  

We actually liked the place so much we went back for brunch on the next day.  Which was even. more. amazing.

Ordered the swordfish tacos (see pics) and Cuban sandwich, and the french toast (see pics) for the munchkin.  The kids French toast was ridiculously awesome.  Here's the most awesome kicker- we were with a big group with 4 kids and the back room was open, so they gave it to us to have our brunch back there so the kids wouldn't bother anyone else.  It was an awesome experience and the whole staff was soooo super nice.  Make sure to check out my food pics- the kids meal was 1/3 eaten when I took the pic, but you can imagine the thrill in junior's eyes when he saw what he got for breakfast! :)

Awesome place guys!  Keep up the good work!
Out of the Pilsner but the Champaign blonde is FANTASTIC!  Jambalaya was a bit too spicy for me. I'm embarrassed to say but true. Service was excellent. They went above and beyond everywhere.

Great area of town for this spot. Waited 20 minutes for a table on a Tuesday night at 8pm. Well worth it. I ordered the gaucho skirt steak and it was much more than I expected. I wouldn't have thought to put a steak on a bed of rice with a jalapeno on top but I would 100% order this amazing dish again. Just the right amount of spice. Made complete with the synchopathic sour beer, which had the perfect tartness to it. We split the Smores dessert and, though I wished it came with more chocolate, it turned out to be the top off that we needed.

Really really nice place. My son in law had a celebratory party here for my daughter, party of about 20.  The servers were wonderful, they never left us alone to wonder about anything at all but they weren't hovering which was nice.  The food was excellent!  The menu was explained thoroughly, the drinks were yummy and not weak. 

I would definitely come here again!

The only reason I'd come back here is for the bacon wrapped dates!  Those babies embodied sweet, savory, smokey, and spicy.  Delish!  Omg, I just realized that delish is almost an anagram for Destihl.  So shall I say it was delisht*?

Too many other things were off about the meal for me to want to return.  Too bad because those desserts sound alluring (pumpkin bread pudding!).

- It took way too long for the waiter (who said he was new) to come back for our order.  Another waitress actually came by to ask how we were doing because she saw us looking around. 
- Long wait for the appetizers.  How long does it take to send over some cheese curds, bacon wrapped dates, and nachos?  The nachos arrived last.  I didn't time it, but the meal was a solid hour and 45 minutes.  I wasn't crazy about the nachos, but the cheese curds were my second fave after the dates.
- My bison burger was extra dry (and I've had juicy bison before), and the bun it came on was too crumbly and dry as well.  I took 2 bites and ditched the rest of the bun.

And the last and final straw:
- My colleague clearly ordered the Carolina pork two ways (the entree is actually like 5 or 6 words on the menu, and he read off every word), but what was served to him was the Carolina wings.  He ended up just eating it because it would've taken forever for the correct entree to come out, based on our experience with the apps and entrees.  Also, rather than bringing out a free dessert or comp'ing the entree off the bill, we were still charged for the incorrect order, and waiter just kept saying thanks for understanding, and "the wings tasting good?"  That is actually the first time in life that I've seen an entree get messed up, and it's still charged on the final bill.  Wth?  I spoke to a manager, who removed the item from the bill.

*the t is silent.  Duh!

I've been to this resturant three times each time fantastic. Service is friendly an upbeat becase the waiters are extremely nice and helpful. It is modern yet comfortable. Food looks and tastes like it's from a high class resturant but not overpriced with big portions. Go here!

Went in a large group and got a private room in the back. Great for big gatherings or when you want to try a new place. Beer is good too and you can take samples before buying a glass

I'd give food recommendation but I swear it's all delicious!

I have been to Destihl a handful of times, and every time I am disappointed. The restaurant decor is very modern and the menu is impressive - often offering delectable-sounding dishes and impressive combinations. 

That said, you may be disappointed upon arrival of your meal. The presentation is beautiful, but the taste is so bland. The first time I had a featured soup and sandwich - both just okay. The second time, I had their Rancher burger, which was wayyy overcooked (I asked for medium-rare and got very well done) and the fries were pretty bland. Some words about leftovers from Destihl: you don't want them. They are terrible as next-day meals. 

Overall, you'll have better luck for your taste buds and wallet by making a trip down the street to Dublin's.

Destihl, Destihl, Destihl. Their food is just bad. So bad. I gave them two chances and I just could not ever do that again. The beer/cheese soup is a salty, goopy mess. The blue cheese and steak quesadilla would have been edible if it wasn't absolutely sopping wet with oil. The burger is bland and if you're lucky (note my sarcasm), you'll get a few nice, chewy chunks of fat in there. I got some kind of s'mores dessert and it was a cheap mess. How can you make a bad s'mores dessert??? It's cruel! Their menu is so awesome, but they're SUCH a tease! They cannot execute anything well. I gave them two stars: one, for the selection in the menu and the other, because I haven't had any beer here and it is kind of a brewery I guess so I can't judge them there. Also, people seem to like their deep-fried bacon, but I personally cannot bring myself to put something like that in my body, but then again I did eat at Destihl TWICE *facepalm*

Oh, Destihl. How badly did I want to love you, but you were not willing.

Oh, Destihl. How I wish you were anything above average. 

I had a delicious brunch at Destihl once (while sitting outside) and it ruined me for life, because for that reason, I feel compelled to keep giving the place a chance at serving me a delicious indoor dinner that's worth the price tag. So far, that just hasn't happened, or even come close. 

I might join friends here for dessert or for drinks and an appetizer, but I've learned my lesson with dinner. I think.
I loved the food and beer selection.  I only wish there were more vegetarian options.  It won't keep me from going back, but I won't go as often as I might if there more veggie-friendly choices:)

We like to go around sampling the different vegetarian options in town, especially veggie burgers. This one is probably the best restaurant style veggie burger in the C-U area. IT is different from the normal black bean burger, although they have that as an option too. It is by no means the best veggie burger I've ever had, but one of the better ones in the area. They also have some tasty beer-battered asparagus sticks. If you're looking for a heavy meal, than this is a good place to go, but they definitely don't do light n healthy...

Have dined at Destihl 3 times and have enjoyed the food every time. I highly recommend reservations. On this visit, we were seated right away while a walk-up couple was told it would be a 30 min wait. The lobby area was busy with people waiting to be seated.

Started with the Potato Croquettes, which had a nice flavor to them. Also sampled 3 of the beers...really enjoy the 4 oz options so I can try a few different varieties.

We were satisfied with our entrees...a pork tenderloin special and the flat iron steak. Great flavors and cooked the way we ordered.

Best part is probably dessert. The smores are a fun, gooey mess and the cherry bread pudding was tasty.

We dined on a Saturday night, which was also prom night in the area and a busy sports night (we were seated in the bar area), so it was a bit noisy. However, Destihl is a good dining option in the CU area.

I love Destihl! We had wonderful service. Our waitress recommended the nachos for an appetizer and they were wonderful. Beware of huge portions! Then I had a stuffed poblano pepper. Who would ever think to put mashed potatoes in there?! It was heavenly! I'd go back in a second and get the exact same meal, except with a bigger appetite!

Visiting from out of town and came here with a small group. Nice location in downtown. The beer selection was OK, but nothing stellar - and one of the beers I got was on the warm side. The ambiance was nice, and it was quiet enough to make it easy to talk with the rest of the table, even though a world series game was on and it was pretty crowded. The food was just mediocre. The fries (which were recommended as a side) were tasty, but a bit soggy. I had a chicken sandwich that was tasty, but the amount of meat was pretty small - it was a thin cut (probably half a breast pounded flat) and I ended up peeling away half the bun, which was twice as big as the cut.

My friends seemed to like their food (burger, bacon-wrapped dates), but I don't think they would give it more than 2.5 or 3 stars either. I gave it 3 stars because the prices were OK, but I'm used to California prices - so this might be more the norm for Champaign.

I absolutely love this restaurant! I go here regularly with friends and family and enjoy the artistry and care put into the making of the food and craft beer. I also highly appreciate that the food ingredients are locally sourced. I've never eaten something at Destihl that I didn't love!

You literally can't go wrong with Distihl. The food is top notch, the service is sublime and the drinks go above and beyond. The only thing you do have to be aware of is that EVERYONE knows it's great - so make reservations!

Of all the nicer restaurants in the downtown champaign area, this is one of my favorites. Most of the food choices are excellent and I can see how the ones I didn't like all that much would appeal to others with different palettes. I'm not much of a beer drinker but friends I've been with have told me it is great. Acceptably priced given the ambiance and portions. My go to for a nice sit-down dinner in the New-American cuisine.

I keep revisiting Destihl because it's easily agreed upon among friends. The food is generally good. The beer can be hit (they once had an incredible Mango IPA) or miss (see below). Ambiance is dim but beautiful - nice for a date, bad lighting for photography. (Why are you taking selfies on a date anyway?) For this occasion, the Bacon & Cheddar Burger ($11.25) was a yes. A hefty hunk of meat nestled in a brioche bun with melted cheddar and a cross-hatch of semi-crisp bacon. Accouterments included the requisite lettuce, tomato, and thin-sliced pickles (which I think really give burgers that extra layer of flavour). I asked for medium-rare and got just that. The side of fries were fab: hand-cut and lightly seasoned. The Oengus Irish Stout (Nitro, starts at $1.40 for 4 ounces) was a no. It tasted like dirty water with a hint of coffee in the postlude. The brown ale might have been better if you enjoy dark & bitter with a bit more complexity. Our waiter was a maybe. He was courteous and lovely and kept our water glasses filled. He claimed he has a good memory but forgot my beer along with that of my companion's. And his rave recommendation of the Oengus Irish Stout seemed like false advertising. Though it doesn't have much to do with the food, he also had great hair imo. Maybe that bolstered our dining experience.
Really good burgers, especially the bun. The fries were really good as well. Drinks were just okay. (Not anything special or mixology)

This restaurant was great. It was noisy, but we were seated in a booth which isolated us from a lot of the noise and felt intimate. Our kids loved the kids menu and spent most of their time coloring it in and playing the games. The chicken tenders and fries they ordered tasted great. We also ordered a Bavarian pretzel appetizer which came with really good spicy mustard and cheese for dipping. My wife and I ordered a bunch of four ounce pours of their different beers. We liked every beer we tried, especially the Clarice Belgian Strong and the Roadblock Red. I ordered the Brewster pizza, which was fantastic and my wife ordered the salmon and potatoe which was also great. Our server was very nice as was everyone we interacted with while there. This place was great.

The Hubster and I decided to do a date night--try out Destihl and then go see The Exorcist at the Virginia (our date night may not be your definition of 'romantic,' but that's neither here nor there).  I'd heard about how crowded Destihl gets around dinnertime, and never having been there before, I went the AARP-route and reserved a table for us at 5:15 to give ample time for slow service (this was unnecessary).  I was surprised to learn that Destihl is cavernous.  There was absolutely no shortage of tables.  How does it ever get crowded?  Who knows?  In any case, we were (irritatingly) seated near the only large, loud party in the entire restaurant.  Nothing like listening to a bunch of screechy teenagers dressed up for Homecoming say semi-racist things and then shush each other on date night!

We got appetizers and small plate-y things to constitute our meal.  All were finger food, all were messy and delicious.  We tried the cheese curds (lightly breaded, crunchy, thoroughly melty), thai chicken wings (a nicely spicy slow burn, flavorful, thick sauced with fabulous peanuts sprinkled over the top), and beer-boiled shrimp (a tad too much seasoning that clung to our fingers and overwhelmed most other flavors, not much beer taste, but otherwise...you know...cold shrimp are tasty on their own).  I tried a pint of their black IPA which I thoroughly enjoyed.  

We also shared their chocolate trio (or M√©nage √† Trois or whatever they call it), which consisted of mexican hot chocolate (thick, hot, nom), a chocolate tart (delicious filling, but with a crust that was absolutely impossible to cut into, making it awkward to eat, much less share), and zanzibar chocolate ice cream (heaven).  

I need to try more things to be sure that this is actually a problem, but I feel like everything on their menu is too complicated.  There are SO MANY INGREDIENTS listed on every single menu item.  Too many seasonings, too many flavor combinations.  Every time I read something, I was like, "Mmm...yes...yes...yes!...oh, no, you went too far."

Our waiter was extremely enthusiastically friendly to the point of making us feel a bit awkward.  I mean, he hung out and chatted.  I don't harbor ill will against the guy or anything--he was really nice!--but you know...I'm on a date with my main squeeze...please leave.

Considering all the stuff we got, our tab was surprisingly cheap.  I think we were out for under $30.  I waffled between 3.5 and 4 stars, but I'm feeling generous today.
Nice ambiance but the beers are bland.  They have no body.  We didn't eat any food but it looked good.   The chef must be good because the beers are aweful

Fabulous restaurant! Ordered the Ruben egg rolls to start and it just continued to be amazing through our dinner! BBQ chicken pizza and fish and chips were really yummy!

Update* went last night and had the stuffed poblano peppers and the wagyu burger and the carrot cake .... All were to die for! I don't like stuffed bell peppers and I cleaned the plate with the poblanos! Well done desthil!!!

We went here for Mother's Day dinner the Monday after. Was impressed with the decor, menu, service, and food. Our service was excellent. I had a Flat Iron Steak and fingerling potatoes w/blue cheese. Steak was cooked perfectly. Potatoes were tasty.

Other people in our group were satisfied with their choices. (We tasted each other's dishes to verify the deliciousness.) Portabella burger, veggie burger, American Kobe burger, chipotle shrimp skewers, & chorizo stuffed dates wrapped in bacon were their choices. We had two appetizers - cheese curds & tempura-fried asparagus. Yum, yum.

One of our dessertw was the highly-promoted banana cream pie. Good, but the bananas were over caramelized. (waiter apologized).

All in all we were very happy with our experience. I hope to take other people to share the Destihl experience.

We've been to Destihl maybe six times now, for brunch, lunch, and dinner. Most of the food is very good, better conceived and made than a lot of other area restaurants offer. Portions are fairly generous (not so much with brunch items), and the price fits the quality of ingredients and preparation. The staffing is good, service is timely, and the decor is charming. 

The craft beers made on site are wonderful. Try a series of 4 ouncers to build your own tasting. The flavor profiles given on the brew menu seem so far to have been accurate.

For appetizers, I recommend the shrimp ceviche (technically a "small plate") and the stone oven pretzels (you get two, with cheese and spicy honey mustard dips). I've tried one soup, the corn and chicken chowder, which was very good, nice SW pepper flavor without overwhelming the chicken. We've had sandwiches and entrees, from burgers to steak, and it's all been really delicious. The food is in the American Contemporary Casual style -- better than Houlihan's at the i-Hotel in our opinion.

The only bad experience we've had with the food has been the cedar plank brie dessert. It was badly prepared (the brie wasn't even room temperature) and either the recipe was off or the honey-chili sauce was made incorrectly, because it was completely unbalanced and unpalatable. The smoke flavor reacted poorly with what was on the plank, too. We took the brie home (a big piece) and cut off the rind to eat the middle later, but it still tasted of rank sauce and smoke. We did not go back to the restaurant for a couple of months because of just how bad this was.  I wrote the general manager and he was good about it, offering to review the recipe and preparation with the lead chef. 

Since returning to Destihl, we've had good experiences again -- the place is consistent, a fun place to socialize, and a nice addition to CU's restaurant scene.

My husband and I met my mom and daughter for lunch here. We ordered cheese curds for an appetizer. I ordered the chicken pot pie and my husband ordered a pizza. The chicken pot pie was awful. I'm ok with changing recipes up a bit but not only did it have very different vegetables that were so undercooked they were almost raw, the flavors did not even resemble a pot pie. My daughter had gotten there after we had ordered and she order the pot pie, until she tasted mine and then we canceled the order and she ate some of my husband pizza. The pizza wasn't bad but nothing to crow about either. I don't think I would go back with all of the other food  choices out there. Waitress was friendly, cheese curds were ok.

Happy Valentine's Day! Came here for a lovely lunch with my boyfriend and it didn't disappoint. The creamy tomato soup and ham&dapple sandwich was very good. My boyfriend had the chicken and biscuits which he very much enjoyed but said the portion seemed a little small with only 1 biscuit. The chocolate cake was very good and moist. The only thing I was Unsatisfied with was the drunks, the island cooler was very sour and almost bland. As well as the cream soda concoction it was bland and flavorless. Overall a good dining experience for this romantic holiday!

Great beer selection - especially if you like sours! They have a pretty diverse and creative menu. I had the vegan zucchini pasta - so good and not too filling (must save room for beer). The side salad I ordered had great beer vinaigrette, but it was mostly cilantro (yuck!) Our waiter basically knew nothing about beer which was comical since it's a brewery, but he was nice all the same. Overall this is a cool spot, and I'd go back.

I've been here many times with my family and friends and have always had a good experience. The staff is friendly, the food is great, and the ambiance is nice. I started making reservations since there is often a wait, but even if you decide to just come in on a whim, it's well worth it. 

I've tried at least 8 different dishes and have truly enjoyed each one. The menu has good variety, including vegan, gluten free, and vegetarian options. 

I really encourage you to try this place out!

Their jambalaya is incredible. It's probably not what you would think to go here for, but it's absolutely worth it. I tried a bison burger once too, and was underwhelmed. It was kind of expensive, dry, and the toppings that came with it reminded me more of a health food salad than a burger. The beer selection is great, and they make some of them in-house, which is cool.

The interior is classy, clean, and modern, and the staff were always friendly. Definitely worth a visit if you're looking for a nicer sit-down restaurant in Chambana.

I love the Destihl in Bloomington-Normal so I had to give this one a try.  A co-worker and I came here for dinner on a Thursday night.  The place was not overly busy but had plenty of business.  I really liked the decor of the place and the booth setup was neat.  Our waitress was very helpful and friendly.

I was happy to see that they have the same menu as the one in Bloomington-Normal with only their beer selection being different.  We started with the Beer Battered Asparagus which was delicious!  I was tempted to get my usual, the White Cheddar Stuffed Poblano Peppers but decided to change it up a bit.  I went with the Potato Crusted Rainbow Trout.  It had wonderful flavor!  My co-worker got my usual and she loved them too.  We decided to go for dessert as well.  I ordered the Creme Brulee.  I was not very impressed by this.  It was a bit on the runny side and I am used to creme brulee being smooth and creamy.

Overall, great food and service!  Love this place!

I went here for lunch with a large group.  I thought the menu selections were unique and gourmet.  We ordered the Fried Asparagus and they were lightly battered and fried to perfection.  Delicious.  My friend is Gluten Free and they have a menu just for GF items....she had some type of pizza that looked and tasted delicious.  We didn't have any alcohol it was a work lunch, so I can't speak to that.
Amazing ! Pesto pizza and the skillet nachos are to die for! Husband and I always go here for date night. Quiet enough to talk and amazing food!

Located in a nice part of downtown Champaign. The interior had a dimly-lit, classy ambiance to it. We were a party of over 20 people and got a side room with huge windows. Service was great considering how many people we had! 

[Cheese Curds] They reminded me of mozzarella sticks except bite-sized. The cheese was well breaded and the tomato sauce was spot on. Considering that this was an appetizer, the portion size was pretty hefty.

[Squash & Cashew Cream] I enjoyed the creaminess of the cashew cream that coated squash pasta. The variety of vegetables in the dish was impressive. The herbs and spices added a light flavor to the dish. However, the overall flavoring was sort of bland. Perfect for someone looking for something really light.

I've been here a few times now and have loved everything I've had. I highly suggest the pretzel appetizer. They are hot and fresh every time. The dipping sauces that come with it, one cheddar cheese sauce and one honey mustard type sauce are both great too.

The charred broccolini salad is delicious. I also recommend the herbivore burger if you like veggie burgers. It is huge though so be prepared to share with someone or take half home. The cedar plank salmon is also very good and comes with grilled vegetables and a nice arugula salad. The salad was a bit too overdressed for my taste so request it to be lightly dressed if you don't like a lot of dressing.

As far as dessert goes I've tried the cherry bread pudding, s'mores, chocolate cake, and the wild sour berry tart and out of all of those I would recommend the tart and the chocolate cake. They give you a pound of chocolate cake so only order it if you are not already stuffed from your meal or if you want to take it home. Half of it was more than enough for 4 of us.
The sours are DESTIHL's specialty for sure.  Stick with 'em and you'll enjoy your drinking experience!

Great selection of beers, food and plenty of unique twists to make it as interesting as anything else within 50 miles. Had a great time here and enjoyed very good service in this trendy looking place.

5/5 stars!!!

I completely agree with Jeffrey T., everything was on point from start to finish.

Four of is dined here at about 5:30pm on Saturday. There was a bit of a wait, but totally worth it.

Great atmosphere. Comfy couches in the waiting area. You can peruse the souvenirs while you wait. 

We were seated in the bar area which turned out to be great. Not noisy and very family-friendly.

The gentleman that seated us (front of house manager? General Manager?) was wonderfully nice and our dining experience only got better from there! Our waiter, Tanner, was outstanding. Probably one of the best waiters I've ever had; very attentive, accommodating and he was able to answer questions about the food. I'd say Desthil does a superb job of training their employees, but I have a feeling they only hire the best to begin with.

Food was delicious. I had the stuffed poblano pepper and hubs ordered the coulette steak. 

Our bill was just under $100 for four adults (pre-tip). This included several 12 oz. beers, Bavarian pretzel appetizer and four entrees. Would love to try some desserts next time.

I really enjoy their Sour beers.

Great food and there's something for everyone, even the non-beer drinkers. Prices are great.

I love that Desthil represents a melting pot of people. From babies to grandparents and everyone in between.

Free, easy to find parking on the street about 1/2 a block away.

We'll be long-time customers!

My personal favorite restaurant at Champaign. Why? In my opinion, they provide the best combination of quality food, craft beer, atmosphere, and reasonable prices. 

The food I've had here has been consistently exceptional. I've had the skillet nachos, cedar plank salmon, jambalaya, bbq pork two-ways, pot roast, Thai fried chicken, and poblano peppers. The Thai fried chicken and pablano peppers were particularly noteworthy and I strongly recommend both for those who enjoy zesty food. 

The beer is well-rounded and contains great choices for ipa's, sours, and others. The best part is the option to buy 4oz flights for 1/4 the price of a regular pint. You can buy 4 flights for the same price that you'd buy a pint and can mix and match all you want. 

The tables are also very spread out and the interior is dim lit with good decor. Includes a bar area for drinks and big screens for games.
Great food and atmosphere. Always enjoy stopping into Destihl when I come through Champaign!

I loved this place! This will be my regular spot when I'm driving through Champaign. We chose this place because there seemed to be vegetarian options and I am so happy we did! We arrived on a Friday evening, which was a bad idea because the wait was like 45 minutes.The restaurant seems separate from the bar and waiting area, which was nice because it was quiet where we ate. It seemed family friendly as a result. There was really good energy in the place.I really enjoyed the atmosphere, which made the wait a bit easier. 
I ordered a cold brew coffee and cream and my date ordered a weissenheimer beer. He lived in Germany years ago and was struck by the flavor of the beer. It reminded him of the days back in Germany. My cold brewed coffee was delicious, as well. I ordered the stuffed poblano pepper and he ordered the blue cornmeal trout. They didn't take long to bring out the food which was surprising seeing as though it was very crowded. The pepper, came with a roasted red pepper sauce and ancho rice and beans was superb! The pepper was charred and had just enough heat to make the tongue tingle, but was still very flavorful. The fish meal was a delicate combination of andouille sausage hash and greens (with pork) over top of the fish with some kid of gravy that pulled it all together. My date enjoyed it immensely. We both cleaned our plates and still ordered dessert! If you follow my reviews, you don't hear me speak about desserts or sweets much, but I have a weakness for bread pudding and they had it on the menu. Sour cherry bread pudding was heavenly (I hate that we decided to share). It was too sweet and the cherries added the right amount of umph. This bread pudding was fluffy enough that it wasn't doughy but dry enough that it remained moist. Perfecto! We walked around the small downtown area after dinner to digest some of the food and was impressed with the variety of bars and restaurants that were in the small area. Like the Terminator said, "I'll be back!"
Relaxed casual atmosphere with wonderful upscale food. The beer was good, the food was great. I would return if I'm ever back in the area.

I recommend this restaurant unreservedly! Service is excellent, but not intrusive or obsequious.  Food is wonderful-salmon, chicken, burgers, all were well prepared and unfailingly delicious. The atmosphere is attractive and upbeat. Definitely one of the best restaurants in s restaurant- 'saturated town!
Very nice restaurant with excellent food and beer.  Great choice of seating, bar, inside or outside.

All right, so I've now been to both locations of Destihl and I have to say they're both pretty good, not stellar but a slightly above average brewpub. I tried their Hawaii five ale which was okay-it was a fruit beer that was supposed to remind me of being on a beach in Hawaii. Well, anything is possible it was a tarter beer but still a very light ale. They didn't have their dunkelweizen here which was disappointing. 

I got hungry waiting for my friend so I ordered the Ancho chips and dip. The chips were just okay but the vinegar and the dressings were really quite good. The habanero vinegar wasn't overpoweringly hot but had a nice kick and the ranch was more than just a ranch dressing. 

I had the bison burger because I haven't had bison meat in a while and it was just as good. The burger though, was all right the bison, slightly sweeter and less greasy than ground beef was good. The dressing on it though took away from the flavor of the meat  but the fries were actually quite tasty.  Overall, it's still an okay place
SLOW SLOW SLOW.. food is fine but the service is way too slow.. my kids will not go there..

Had the steak, asparagus, and potatoes. The steak was just a steak with some butter, salt and pepper--nothing outgoing. The asparagus was under-cooked, but not bad. The potatoes were delicious though!
Great almosphere, drink choices, and food.  Comfortable for a group or a romantic night out.
Yum! Original and fun gastro pub food. Great atmosphere. Best place I have eaten at U of I.

Everything I've had here is exceptional. Most dishes are above average to excellent. Beers are usually decent. The saison i had recently was outstanding and so drinkable. Nice soft fruit profile with a hint of fall spice. Idk what people below have been ordering, but I've yet to be disappointed. Probably skip the pizzas just because there are better pies elsewhere. The trout and salmon are great, goucho steak is good, the cuban and the other pork sandwich are solid, the bison burger is perfect, salads are solid too. Get the fried green tomatoes, ceviche, or Bavarian pretzels as appetizers. Dessert-wise, the lemon berry cream cake is to die for! Like the perfect middle ground between angel food cake and pound cake, with a touch of mascapone. So moist! Really, can't comprehend the hate. Also the person slamming them for no vegan options... lol ok
Nice selection of on premises brewed beer and a good menu with a broad selection of choices.

Staff - amazing.
Food - outstanding.
Beer - terrific.

'nuff said.

I did have the Brewmasters Pizza, roadblock red and the Belgian Trippel.  Recommend them all.
We had the best food and service ever. We are in for a wedding. Otherwise I'd be here every single day. If you get down here, this is a must go to!

I used to come to this place often and it was very good! But I went last night at around 9:30 PM and was highly disappointed by the service and food. I understand that it was a Friday night and it was busy but I expected much better service and better quality food. For instance, the fries that came with the sandwich I ordered were soggy, not fresh, and it appeared that they were sitting in the kitchen for a long time. To add to to my night, the waiter was not very friendly and dry! But at the same time I was impressed with the presentation of the food. Overall, I was very upset about my visit and do not plan on coming back.
Love this place- I go here for lunch all the time.  It's close to my office and they offer a nice variety of food choices.

As a vegan, I never have high hopes in the Midwest for finding things I can eat besides salad, but DESTIHL had a handful of vegan options and the veggie cashew pasta was actually pretty good! The non-vegans I was with were less enthused by the options though.

Highly recommended by the concierge at my hotel but failed to deliver. Atmosphere was great and so was the service. 
The food, however, was disappointing. I had a steak spinach salad. The steak was cooked perfect. The spinach tasted dirty and the dressing it came with was weirdly sweet so it didn't pair well with anything else on the plate. Table ordered fried asparagus which tasted exactly like fried asparagus *shrug*.
I asked for a side of their pickles since they make them in-house and they were the highlight of my meal.

Highly recommended! Nice bar with a great selection of their beers. I particularly like the Nut Brown Ale but there are several other styles to choose from. As for dining, we love Destihl. This time we had the Reuben Egg Rolls which were excellent. I had the Chicken Corn Chowder which was one of the best I've ever tasted. For dinner I had the Swordfish dinner. It has a very nice and spicy glaze and is served on a bed of arugula and other spiced veggies. Very impressive, very tasty, but it was a little small which the server told me ahead of time. Not the best choice if you are looking for a big meal, but a very good dish overall. My friend had the Pork rib and pulled pork dish with cole slaw and potatoes. I was very good, had a nice kick to it. Everything is served with a modern flair and a unique flavor profile. This is not your typical boring brew pub food. Very stylish. The atmosphere is nicer that most brew pubs and is great for a nice dinner out with friends. I am never disappointed at Destihl!!

Dishes can be hit or miss here but overall I enjoy Destihl. I recommend this for groups or other gatherings since it is casual but still pretty nice. I like the pretzels for appetizer, the burgers for entree, and the banana cream pie for dessert (it is seriously awesome).

We had a fantastic time at Destihl!
We had our family Birthday party 8 people.
Started off with drinks and appetizers,
We had fried asparagus, bacon, and cheese curd all Yummy!
I had the Pot roast (delicious)
Our waiter was Dom he's the best!
We had Carrot cake for desert which we shared another DELICIOUS desert!
Definitely will be back.
Love this restaurant! Great beers! I go here every chance I get. The menu changes seasonally and just about everything I've ordered has been wonderful! Service is always on par.

Overall, not impressed. My family decided to something a bit different this year and went to a new restaurant vs. going to old standbys. After finding a list of top restaurants online, we ended up settling on Destihl due to the large menu with seemingly lots of tasty options.

We made a reservation for a Monday night and we were seated right away. Parking can be a bit difficult mid-evening. We had to circle around the nearby city lot to finally find a spot. 

My order: Chorizo stuffed dates to share and Thai steak salad.

Other orders: Clam chowder (the soup of the day), House salad, Spicy Thai shrimp, and Pesto Chicken (recommended by the waiter).

The dates came out first. I didn't realize they were going to be wrapped in bacon. But score, I love it that way. The bacon needed to be cooked a bit more though. They had a nice kick to them. They were enjoyed for the most part, but these are much better in Atlanta.

As for main meal, the accidentally brought my mom a Caesar salad instead of the House salad. She was going to order it but changed her mind. The waiter forgot to write down the change. He came out quickly to apologize after it was delivered. The salad is a wedge salad with a crispy toast in place of croutons and a fried egg. My mom wasn't excited about the fried egg and gave it to us. I tasted it but didn't like it so passed it on to my brother. How do you mess up a fried egg?

My Thai steak salad was not very good. The steak was cooked more medium than medium well. There was not much of it. The greens were kinda soggy. The peanuts were way too salty. Much better in Atlanta, again.

Overall, portion sizes were adequate and we got our fill. We signed up for a rewards card that evening and were able to apply the purchase that we had just made to our rewards card. That was great. Even though I may not be back. There were plenty of other options that seemed great on the menu, but hesitant after this experience. Plus there are other places to try in the city.

Everyone else liked their food. So that's something. I was going to give them 3 stars given everyone else's satisfaction. But then I realized that I had noted in our reservation that we were celebrating my dad's birthday. They didn't do anything to signify that. Not even a happy birthday. Nothing! So 2 stars it is.
This is by far my favorite place in the Champaign/ Urbana area. The food and beer is always wonderful. Last night I had the Thai Chicken. I will be back next time I am in town!

Great service by our waiter. He knew the menu in & out. Took me so long to choose what to order because they have too many good looking options on their menu! 

Finally decided to get the bacon, blue cheese pizza but switched out the blue cheese for Goat cheese! One of the best pizzas I've ever had! So much creamy goodness in this pizza.
Have eaten here a couple times, once for dinner and once for brunch - food is always great.

Second time here and have loved it both times!   Here with 2 different couples and each time everyone totally enjoyed the food and the service.  The rib eye is on the expensive side but very flavorable.  A great menu - generally decent pricing.  The carrot cake could easily serve 4 and is as good as you will ever have.

Yeah, Destihl has become a place that I am alright with eating at rather than a groan-worthy thing when other people suggest it.  It's still a smidge on the pricey side but it's a decent value and the food is usually pretty tasty.  The posole is pretty good and I think there's a pork tenderloin sandwich that is also decent.

I'd never choose it myself but I don't mind it.  I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.

Came for dinner on a Friday night at 5pm with a party of 12 and just had the best time! The staff was super friendly, I had to call twice to update my reservation and they were very accommodating. We were seated right away and our waiter (Brad?) was amazing!!! Super knowledgeable and extremely patient with all of us. 

The food has never been a miss for me.  I've come here several times and tried their jambalaya, a salad and this time a pasta and they've all been excellent.  We started with the beer-battered asparagus as an appetizer (it comes with 5 very large pieces and I split with someone else) and the flavor was melt in your mouth good. There's nothing too overpowering (sweetness or saltiness) about the batter/glaze and the asparagus flavor was very muted. This is marked as one of their signature dishes and with good reason :) For my entree, I decided to go a little bit healthier tonight and order the Squash and Cashew Cream pasta, which is both vegan and gluten free and WOW! It was incredibly incredibly delicious, I'm not sure what they put in that cashew sauce but it literally blew me away. Cannot rave enough about this, I'm so impressed considering that its Vegan/GF.

I was able to try bits of the carolina style bbq pork, the fish and chips as well as the stuffed poblano pepper and they were all fantastic.

The service was a tad bit slow, but we had a good-sized party and there were no mistakes in our separate checks (honestly, if an establishment is willing to do this for a large group, they deserve a 5/5), so I definitely appreciated it. 

This place is great for a date or to bring a group of friends who are looking for a classy vibe but you can still wear jeans and be comfortable.  4th great experience here and I will be back for sure.

Traveling on our way to Colorado, all the way from Maryland, we were famished and beleaguered. We wanted some good food.

We were in for a pleasant surprise. 

We started with pretzels as appetizers. They were the perfect balance between soft and hard, and were very filling. One could easily just come here for the pretzels alone. But then I got the pot roast. 

My mind was BLOWN.

To put it simply, it was like taking small forkfuls of heaven and putting it in my mouth. Tender meat and potatoes, and delicious gravy. Everything about it was perfect. As a bonus, I used the leftover pretzel to dip in the gravy, and it further amplified its flavor! 

Would go here all the time if we lived anywhere near here.

Beer is pretty good.   I'm not normally impressed with the offerings of small brewpubs, but this place is OK.   Liked every beer I was served.

Appetizers were good.   I enjoyed the bacon-wrapped dates.

Things fell apart a bit when it came to our main meal.   My hamburger was overcooked and uninteresting.   No condiments for my sandwich.   And waitstaff sorta evaporated once our food was delivered.

This is a restaurant I would visit to sit at the bar and enjoy beer and snacks.   But for lunch or dinner, I'd take my meal elsewhere.

A few friends and I came here on a Friday night to have dinner. The food was great and so was the atmosphere. The problem i had was that it took 15 minutes to get water, and then another 20 for someone to take our order. Unfortunately it took an hour to get our food served to us. The food was brought out to us nice and hot, however the wait was not worth it. Destihl is a great local hang out and I usually don't have an issue with time there. I recommend either the Brew Master's Pizza, or the Beer Battered Bacon and egg burger.

Food was good, service was good. I wish their beer menu had descriptions though. This seemed more like a food place with beer than a "brewery". It wasn't quite as relaxed as other breweries we've been to. 
The beer we had was pretty good. We're big fans of the wild sour series, so we were glad to be able to enjoy some on tap.

Destihl-ness is the move! 

They've only been open a few weeks but I'm predicting that this place is going to become an institution here in Champaign-Urbana. They're not quite there yet, BUT this four stars is partially based on potential. I don't know if that's acceptable for Yelp, but whatever.

I will admit I got a little gluttonous this evening. Ideally, I wouldn't have eaten as much as I did, but it was what it was. I started off with some of the home brews. I did the the little 4 oz guys and out of the four I tried, I liked three enough to drink again (the Belgian ale was a bit too hoppy for my liking). At $1.25 each (or $5 for the 4), I don't mind one I didn't like.

Next I went with the beer-cheese soup. WHAT WHAT WHAT WHAT WHAT. It was amazingly good. Also, at my table were some cheese curds and I will dare say that these curds were the finest curds I have ever eaten (and I've had them in Wisconsin too). 

For my entree, I went with the bison burger which was flavorful - although I will echo the review who noted that their meat was overcooked - and I appreciated that fries were included. The fries were awesome - shoestring style and were not oversalted, but weren't seasoned improperly either (just right!).

For dessert it was baked apples with butter pecan ice cream. It was wildly decadent and irresponsibly delicious. 

The service is not awful but you can tell that the servers are still getting their feet wet. No worries though. The food was totes worth the wait. 

I'll be back no doubt and I'm pretty sure I'll be updating with 5 stars.

I'm not a huge beer fan but that doesn't matter because the food is very good and so is the service (thanks Devyn for a wonderful meal)!  You can make a reservation using Yelp - so do that!  I appreciate that they have little 4oz pours of their beers so that I could have one (Samhain Pumpkin) and taste their artistry.  If you love beer, please go here!  We had the Tri Color Roasted Curry Carrots as our "veg" (it's an appetizer) and the spiciness and toasted flavor was a huge hit.  Other menu items like Bacon Mac 'n' Cheese and Pesto Pasta pair really well with the beer and are solid items.  The favority (no surprise) was the four-layer carrot cake - Oh My we were uhmming so much while sharing.  We intend to go again next time we are in town!
